citi 8 1 all peopl gather themselv togeth as one man street that wa water gate they spake unto ezra scribe bring book law mose which lord had command israel 8 2 ezra priest brought law congreg both men women all that could hear understand first day seventh month 8 3 he read therein street that wa water gate morn midday men women those that could understand ear all peopl were attent unto book law 8 4 ezra scribe stood pulpit wood which they had made purpos besid him stood mattithiah shema anaiah urijah hilkiah maaseiah hi right hand hi left hand pedaiah mishael malchiah hashum hashbadana zechariah meshullam 8 5 ezra open book sight all peopl he wa all peopl when he open it all peopl stood 8 6 ezra bless lord great god all peopl answer amen amen lift their hand they bow their head worship lord their face ground 8 7 also jeshua bani sherebiah jamin akkub shabbethai hodijah maaseiah kelita azariah jozabad hanan pelaiah levit caus peopl understand law peopl stood their place 8 8 so they read book law god distinctli gave sens caus them understand read 8 9 nehemiah which is tirshatha ezra priest scribe levit that taught peopl said unto all peopl thi day is holi unto lord your god mourn not nor weep all peopl wept when they heard word law 8 10 then he said unto them go your way eat fat drink sweet send portion unto them whom noth is prepar thi day is holi unto our lord neither be ye sorri joy lord is your strength 8 11 so levit still all peopl say hold your peac day is holi neither be ye griev 8 12 all peopl went their way eat drink send portion make great mirth becaus they had understood word that were declar unto them 8 13 second day were gather togeth chief father all peopl priest levit unto ezra scribe even understand word law 8 14 they found written law which lord had command mose that children israel should dwell booth feast seventh month 8 15 that they should publish proclaim all their citi jerusalem say go forth unto mount fetch oliv branch pine branch myrtl branch palm branch branch thick tree make booth as it is written 8 16 so peopl went forth brought them made themselv booth everi one roof hi hous their court court hous god street water gate street gate ephraim 8 17 all congreg them that were come again captiv made booth sat booth day jeshua son nun unto that day had not children israel done so there wa veri great glad 8 18 also day day first day unto last day he read book law god they kept feast seven day eighth day wa solemn assembl accord unto manner 9 1 now twenti fourth day thi month children israel were assembl fast sackcloth earth them 9 2 seed israel separ themselv all stranger stood confess their sin iniqu their father 9 3 they stood their place read book law lord their god one fourth part day anoth fourth part they confess worship lord their god 9 4 then stood stair levit jeshua bani kadmiel shebaniah bunni sherebiah bani chenani cri loud voic unto lord their god 9 5 then levit jeshua kadmiel bani hashabniah sherebiah hodijah shebaniah pethahiah said stand bless lord your god ever ever bless be thi gloriou name which is exalt all bless prais 9 6 thou even thou art lord alon thou hast made heaven heaven heaven all their host earth all thing that are therein sea all that is therein thou preservest them all host heaven worshippeth thee 9 7 thou art lord god who didst choos abram broughtest him forth ur chalde gavest him name abraham 9 8 foundest hi heart faith thee madest coven him give land canaanit hittit amorit perizzit jebusit girgashit give it i say hi seed hast perform thi word thou art righteou 9 9 didst see afflict our father egypt heardest their cri red sea 9 10 shewedst sign wonder pharaoh all hi servant all peopl hi land thou knewest that they dealt proudli against them so didst thou get thee name as it is thi day 9 11 thou didst divid sea them so that they went midst sea dri land their persecutor thou threwest deep as stone mighti water 9 12 moreov thou leddest them day cloudi pillar night pillar fire give them light way wherein they should go 9 13 thou camest down also mount sinai spakest them heaven gavest them right judgment true law good statut command 9 14 madest known unto them thi holi sabbath commandedst them precept statut law hand mose thi servant 9 15 gavest them bread heaven their hunger broughtest forth water them rock their thirst promisedst them that they should go possess land which thou hadst sworn give them 9 16 but they our father dealt proudli harden their neck hearken not thi command 9 17 refus obey neither were mind thi wonder that thou didst them but harden their neck their rebellion appoint captain return their bondag but thou art god readi pardon graciou merci slow anger great kind forsookest them not 9 18 yea when they had made them molten calf said thi is thi god that brought thee egypt had wrought great provoc 9 19 yet thou thi manifold merci forsookest them not wilder pillar cloud depart not them day lead them way neither pillar fire night shew them light way wherein they should go 9 20 thou gavest also thi good spirit instruct them withheldest not thi manna their mouth gavest them water their thirst 9 21 yea forti year didst thou sustain them wilder so that they lack noth their cloth wax not old their feet swell not 9 22 moreov thou gavest them kingdom nation didst divid them corner so they possess land sihon land king heshbon land og king bashan 9 23 their children also multipliedst thou as star heaven broughtest them land concern which thou hadst promis their father that they should go possess it 9 24 so children went possess land thou subduedst them inhabit land canaanit gavest them their hand their king peopl land that they might do them as they would 9 25 they took strong citi fat land possess hous full all good well dig vineyard oliveyard fruit tree abund so they did eat were fill becam fat delight themselv thi great good 9 26 nevertheless they were disobedi rebel against thee cast thi law behind their back slew thi prophet which testifi against them turn them thee they wrought great provoc 9 27 therefor thou deliveredst them hand their enemi who vex them time their troubl when they cri unto thee thou heardest them heaven accord thi manifold merci thou gavest them saviour who save them hand their enemi 9 28 but they had rest they did evil again thee therefor leftest thou them land their enemi so that they had dominion them yet when they return cri unto thee thou heardest them heaven mani time didst thou deliv them accord thi merci 9 29 testifiedst against them that thou mightest bring them again unto thi law yet they dealt proudli hearken not unto thi command but sin against thi judgment which if man do he shall live them withdrew shoulder harden their neck would not hear 9 30 yet mani year didst thou forbear them testifiedst against them thi spirit thi prophet yet would they not give ear therefor gavest thou them hand peopl land 9 31 nevertheless thi great merci sake thou didst not utterli consum them nor forsak them thou art graciou merci god 9 32 now therefor our god great mighti terribl god who keepest coven merci let not all troubl seem littl thee that hath come us our king our princ our priest our prophet our father all thi peopl time king assyria unto thi day 9 33 howbeit thou art just all that is brought us thou hast done right but we have done wickedli 9 34 neither have our king our princ our priest nor our father kept thi law nor hearken unto thi command thi testimoni wherewith thou didst testifi against them 9 35 they have not serv thee their kingdom thi great good that thou gavest them larg fat land which thou gavest them neither turn they their wick work 9 36 behold we are servant thi day land that thou gavest unto our father eat fruit thereof good thereof behold we are servant it 9 37 it yieldeth much increas unto king whom thou hast set us becaus our sin also they have dominion our bodi our cattl their pleasur we are great distress 9 38 becaus all thi we make sure coven write it our princ levit priest seal unto it 10 1 now those that seal were nehemiah tirshatha son hachaliah bilgai shemaiah these were priest 10 9 levit both jeshua son azaniah binnui son henadad kadmiel 10 10 their brethren shebaniah hodijah kelita pelaiah hanan 10 11 micha rehob hashabiah 10 12 zaccur hashabnah maaseiah 10 26 ahijah hanan anan 10 27 malluch harim baanah 10 28 rest peopl priest levit porter singer nethinim all they that had separ themselv peopl land unto law god their wive their son their daughter everi one have knowledg have understand 10 29 they clave their brethren their nobl enter curs oath walk god s law which wa given mose servant god observ do all command lord our lord hi judgment hi statut 10 30 that we would not give our daughter unto peopl land not take their daughter our son 10 31 if peopl land bring ware or ani victual sabbath day sell that we would not buy it them sabbath or holi day that we would leav seventh year exact everi debt 10 32 also we made ordin us charg ourselv yearli third part shekel servic hous our god 10 33 shewbread continu meat offer continu burnt offer sabbath new moon set feast holi thing sin offer make aton israel all work hous our god 10 34 we cast lot priest levit peopl wood offer bring it hous our god hous our father time appoint year year burn altar lord our god as it is written law 10 35 bring firstfruit our ground firstfruit all fruit all tree year year unto hous lord 10 36 also firstborn our son our cattl as it is written law firstl our herd our flock bring hous our god unto priest that minist hous our god 10 37 that we should bring firstfruit our dough our offer fruit all manner tree wine oil unto priest chamber hous our god tith our ground unto levit that same levit might have tith all citi our tillag 10 38 priest son aaron shall be levit when levit take tith levit shall bring tith tith unto hous our god chamber treasur hous 10 39 children israel children levi shall bring offer corn new wine oil unto chamber where are vessel sanctuari priest that minist porter singer we will not forsak hous our god 11 1 ruler peopl dwelt jerusalem rest peopl also cast lot bring one ten dwell jerusalem holi citi nine part dwell other citi 11 2 peopl bless all men that willingli offer themselv dwell jerusalem 11 3 now these are chief provinc that dwelt jerusalem but citi judah dwelt everi one hi possess their citi wit israel priest levit nethinim children solomon s servant 11 4 jerusalem dwelt certain treasur offer firstfruit tith gather them field citi portion law priest levit judah rejoic priest levit that wait 12 45 both singer porter kept ward their god ward purif accord command david solomon hi son 12 46 day david asaph old there were chief singer song prais thanksgiv unto god 12 47 all israel day zerubbabel day nehemiah gave portion singer porter everi day hi portion they sanctifi holi thing unto levit levit sanctifi them unto children aaron 13 1 that day they read book mose audienc peopl therein wa found written that ammonit moabit should not come congreg god ever 13 2 becaus they met not children israel bread water but hire balaam against them that he should curs them howbeit our god turn curs bless 13 3 now it came pass when they had heard law that they separ israel all mix multitud 13 4 thi eliashib priest have oversight chamber hous our god wa alli unto tobiah 13 5 he had prepar him great chamber where aforetim they laid meat offer frankincens vessel tith corn new wine oil which wa command be given levit singer porter offer priest 13 6 but all thi time wa not i jerusalem two thirtieth year artaxerx king babylon came i unto king certain day obtain i leav king 13 7 i came jerusalem understood evil that eliashib did tobiah prepar him chamber court hous god 13 8 it griev me sore therefor i cast forth all household stuff tobiah chamber 13 9 then i command they cleans chamber thither brought i again vessel hous god meat offer frankincens 13 10 i perceiv that portion levit had not been given them levit singer that did work were fled everi one hi field 13 11 then contend i ruler said whi is hous god forsaken i gather them togeth set them their place 13 12 then brought all judah tith corn new wine oil unto treasuri 13 13 i made treasur treasuri shelemiah priest zadok scribe levit pedaiah next them wa hanan son zaccur son mattaniah they were count faith their offic wa distribut unto their brethren 13 14 rememb me o my god concern thi wipe not my good deed that i have done hous my god offic thereof 13 15 those day saw i judah some tread wine press sabbath bring sheav lade ass as also wine grape fig all manner burden which they brought jerusalem sabbath day i testifi against them day wherein they sold victual 13 16 there dwelt men tyre also therein which brought fish all manner ware sold sabbath unto children judah jerusalem 13 17 then i contend nobl judah said unto them what evil thing is thi that ye do profan sabbath day 13 18 did not your father thu did not our god bring all thi evil us thi citi yet ye bring more wrath israel profan sabbath 13 19 it came pass that when gate jerusalem began be dark sabbath i command that gate should be shut charg that they should not be open till sabbath some my servant set i gate that there should no burden be brought sabbath day 13 20 so merchant seller all kind ware lodg jerusalem onc or twice 13 21 then i testifi against them said unto them whi lodg ye wall if ye do so again i will lay hand you that time forth came they no more sabbath 13 22 i command levit that they should cleans themselv that they should come keep gate sanctifi sabbath day rememb me o my god concern thi also spare me accord great thi merci 13 23 those day also saw i jew that had marri wive ashdod ammon moab 13 24 their children spake half speech ashdod could not speak jew languag but accord languag each peopl 13 25 i contend them curs them smote certain them pluck off their hair made them swear god say ye shall not give your daughter unto their son nor take their daughter unto your son or yourselv 13 26 did not solomon king israel sin these thing yet mani nation wa there no king like him who wa belov hi god god made him king all israel nevertheless even him did outlandish women caus sin 13 27 shall we then hearken unto you do all thi great evil transgress against our god marri strang wive 13 28 one son joiada son eliashib high priest wa son law sanballat horonit therefor i chase him me 13 29 rememb them o my god becaus they have defil priesthood coven priesthood levit 13 30 thu cleans i them all stranger appoint ward priest levit everi one hi busi 13 31 wood offer time appoint firstfruit rememb me o my god good book esther 1 1 now it came pass day ahasueru thi is ahasueru which reign india even unto ethiopia hundr seven twenti provinc 1 2 that those day when king ahasueru sat throne hi kingdom which wa shushan palac 1 3 third year hi reign he made feast unto all hi princ hi servant power persia media nobl princ provinc be him 1 4 when he shew rich hi gloriou kingdom honour hi excel majesti mani day even hundr fourscor day 1 5 when these day were expir king made feast unto all peopl that were present shushan palac both unto great small seven day court garden king s palac 1 6 where were white green blue hang fasten cord fine linen purpl silver ring pillar marbl bed were gold silver pavement red blue white black marbl 1 7 they gave them drink vessel gold vessel be divers one anoth royal wine abund accord state king 1 8 drink wa accord law none did compel so king had appoint all offic hi hous that they should do accord everi man s pleasur 1 9 also vashti queen made feast women royal hous which belong king ahasueru 1 10 seventh day when heart king wa merri wine he command mehuman biztha harbona bigtha abagtha zethar carca seven chamberlain that serv presenc ahasueru king 1 11 bring vashti queen king crown royal shew peopl princ her beauti she wa fair look 1 12 but queen vashti refus come king s command hi chamberlain therefor wa king veri wroth hi anger burn him 1 13 then king said wise men which knew time so wa king s manner all that knew law judgment 1 14 next unto him wa carshena shethar admatha tarshish mere marsena memucan seven princ persia media which saw king s face which sat first kingdom 1 15 what shall we do unto queen vashti accord law becaus she hath not perform command king ahasueru chamberlain 1 16 memucan answer king princ vashti queen hath not done wrong king onli but also all princ all peopl that are all provinc king ahasueru 1 17 thi deed queen shall come abroad unto all women so that they shall despis their husband their eye when it shall be report king ahasueru command vashti queen be brought him but she came not 1 18 likewis shall ladi persia media say thi day unto all king s princ which have heard deed queen thu shall there aris too much contempt wrath 1 19 if it pleas king let there go royal command him let it be written law persian mede that it be not alter that vashti come no more king ahasueru let king give her royal estat unto anoth that is better than she 1 20 when king s decre which he shall make shall be publish all hi empir it is great all wive shall give their husband honour both great small 1 21 say pleas king princ king did accord word memucan 1 22 he sent letter all king s provinc everi provinc accord write thereof everi peopl their languag that everi man should bear rule hi own hous that it should be publish accord languag everi peopl 2 1 these thing when wrath king ahasueru wa appeas he rememb vashti what she had done what wa decre against her 2 2 then said king s servant that minist unto him let there be fair young virgin sought king 2 3 let king appoint offic all provinc hi kingdom that they may gather togeth all fair young virgin unto shushan palac hous women unto custodi hege king s chamberlain keeper women let their thing purif be given them 2 4 let maiden which pleaseth king be queen instead vashti thing pleas king he did so 2 5 now shushan palac there wa certain jew whose name wa mordecai son jair son shimei son kish benjamit 2 6 who had been carri away jerusalem captiv which had been carri away jeconiah king judah whom nebuchadnezzar king babylon had carri away 2 7 he brought hadassah that is esther hi uncl s daughter she had neither father nor mother maid wa fair beauti whom mordecai when her father mother were dead took hi own daughter 2 8 so it came pass when king s command hi decre wa heard when mani maiden were gather togeth unto shushan palac custodi hegai that esther wa brought also unto king s hous custodi hegai keeper women 2 9 maiden pleas him she obtain kind him he speedili gave her her thing purif such thing as belong her seven maiden which were meet be given her king s hous he prefer her her maid unto best place hous women 2 10 esther had not shew her peopl nor her kindr mordecai had charg her that she should not shew it 2 11 mordecai walk everi day court women s hous know how esther did what should becom her 2 12 now when everi maid s turn wa come go king ahasueru that she had been twelv month accord manner women so were day their purif accomplish wit six month oil myrrh six month sweet odour other thing purifi women 2 13 then thu came everi maiden unto king whatsoev she desir wa given her go her hous women unto king s hous 2 14 even she went morrow she return second hous women custodi shaashgaz king s chamberlain which kept concubin she came unto king no more king delight her that she were call name 2 15 now when turn esther daughter abihail uncl mordecai who had taken her hi daughter wa come go unto king she requir noth but what hegai king s chamberlain keeper women appoint esther obtain favour sight all them that look her 2 16 so esther wa taken unto king ahasueru hi hous royal tenth month which is month tebeth seventh year hi reign 2 17 king love esther all women she obtain grace favour hi sight more than all virgin so that he set royal crown her head made her queen instead vashti 2 18 then king made great feast unto all hi princ hi servant even esther s feast he made releas provinc gave gift accord state king 2 19 when virgin were gather togeth second time then mordecai sat king s gate 2 20 esther had not yet shew her kindr nor her peopl as mordecai had charg her esther did command mordecai like as when she wa brought him 2 21 those day while mordecai sat king s gate two king s chamberlain bigthan teresh those which kept door were wroth sought lay hand king ahasueru 2 22 thing wa known mordecai who told it unto esther queen esther certifi king thereof mordecai s name 2 23 when inquisit wa made matter it wa found therefor they were both hang tree it wa written book chronicl king 3 1 these thing did king ahasueru promot haman son hammedatha agagit advanc him set hi seat all princ that were him 3 2 all king s servant that were king s gate bow reverenc haman king had so command concern him but mordecai bow not nor did him rever 3 3 then king s servant which were king s gate said unto mordecai whi transgressest thou king s command 3 4 now it came pass when they spake daili unto him he hearken not unto them that they told haman see mordecai s matter would stand he had told them that he wa jew 3 5 when haman saw that mordecai bow not nor did him rever then wa haman full wrath 3 6 he thought scorn lay hand mordecai alon they had shew him peopl mordecai wherefor haman sought destroy all jew that were whole kingdom ahasueru even peopl mordecai 3 7 first month that is month nisan twelfth year king ahasueru they cast pur that is lot haman day day month month twelfth month that is month adar 3 8 haman said unto king ahasueru there is certain peopl scatter abroad dispers peopl all provinc thi kingdom their law are divers all peopl neither keep they king s law therefor it is not king s profit suffer them 3 9 if it pleas king let it be written that they may be destroy i will pay ten thousand talent silver hand those that have charg busi bring it king s treasuri 3 10 king took hi ring hi hand gave it unto haman son hammedatha agagit jew enemi 3 11 king said unto haman silver is given thee peopl also do them as it seemeth good thee 3 12 then were king s scribe call thirteenth day first month there wa written accord all that haman had command unto king s lieuten governor that were everi provinc ruler everi peopl everi provinc accord write thereof everi peopl their languag name king ahasueru wa it written seal king s ring 3 13 letter were sent post all king s provinc destroy kill caus perish all jew both young old littl children women one day even thirteenth day twelfth month which is month adar take spoil them prey 3 14 copi write command be given everi provinc wa publish unto all peopl that they should be readi against that day 3 15 post went be hasten king s command decre wa given shushan palac king haman sat down drink but citi shushan wa perplex 4 1 when mordecai perceiv all that wa done mordecai rent hi cloth put sackcloth ash went midst citi cri loud bitter cri 4 2 came even king s gate none might enter king s gate cloth sackcloth 4 3 everi provinc whithersoev king s command hi decre came there wa great mourn jew fast weep wail mani lay sackcloth ash 4 4 so esther s maid her chamberlain came told it her then wa queen exceedingli griev she sent raiment cloth mordecai take away hi sackcloth him but he receiv it not 4 5 then call esther hatach one king s chamberlain whom he had appoint attend her gave him command mordecai know what it wa whi it wa 4 6 so hatach went forth mordecai unto street citi which wa king s gate 4 7 mordecai told him all that had happen unto him sum money that haman had promis pay king s treasuri jew destroy them 4 8 also he gave him copi write decre that wa given shushan destroy them shew it unto esther declar it unto her charg her that she should go unto king make supplic unto him make request him her peopl 4 9 hatach came told esther word mordecai 4 10 again esther spake unto hatach gave him command unto mordecai 4 11 all king s servant peopl king s provinc do know that whosoev man or women shall come unto king inner court who is not call there is one law hi put him death such whom king shall hold golden sceptr that he may live but i have not been call come unto king these thirti day 4 12 they told mordecai esther s word 4 13 then mordecai command answer esther think not thyself that thou shalt escap king s hous more than all jew 4 14 if thou altogeth holdest thi peac thi time then shall there enlarg deliver aris jew anoth place but thou thi father s hous shall be destroy who knoweth thou art come kingdom such time as thi 4 15 then esther bade them return mordecai thi answer 4 16 go gather togeth all jew that are present shushan fast ye me neither eat nor drink three day night or day i also my maiden will fast likewis so will i go unto king which is not accord law if i perish i perish 4 17 so mordecai went hi way did accord all that esther had command him 5 1 now it came pass third day that esther put her royal apparel stood inner court king s hous against king s hous king sat hi royal throne royal hous against gate hous 5 2 it wa so when king saw esther queen stand court that she obtain favour hi sight king held esther golden sceptr that wa hi hand so esther drew near touch top sceptr 5 3 then said king unto her what wilt thou queen esther what is thi request it shall be even given thee half kingdom 5 4 esther answer if it seem good unto king let king haman come thi day unto banquet that i have prepar him 5 5 then king said caus haman make hast that he may do as esther hath said so king haman came banquet that esther had prepar 5 6 king said unto esther banquet wine what is thi petit it shall be grant thee what is thi request even half kingdom it shall be perform 5 7 then answer esther said my petit my request is 5 8 if i have found favour sight king if it pleas king grant my petit perform my request let king haman come banquet that i shall prepar them i will do morrow as king hath said 5 9 then went haman forth that day joy glad heart but when haman saw mordecai king s gate that he stood not nor move him he wa full indign against mordecai 5 10 nevertheless haman refrain himself when he came home he sent call hi friend zeresh hi wife 5 11 haman told them glori hi rich multitud hi children all thing wherein king had promot him how he had advanc him princ servant king 5 12 haman said moreov yea esther queen did let no man come king unto banquet that she had prepar but myself morrow am i invit unto her also king 5 13 yet all thi availeth me noth so long as i see mordecai jew sit king s gate 5 14 then said zeresh hi wife all hi friend unto him let gallow be made fifti cubit high morrow speak thou unto king that mordecai may be hang thereon then go thou merrili king unto banquet thing pleas haman he caus gallow be made 6 1 that night could not king sleep he command bring book record chronicl they were read king 6 2 it wa found written that mordecai had told bigthana teresh two king s chamberlain keeper door who sought lay hand king ahasueru 6 3 king said what honour digniti hath been done mordecai thi then said king s servant that minist unto him there is noth done him 6 4 king said who is court now haman wa come outward court king s hous speak unto king hang mordecai gallow that he had prepar him 6 5 king s servant said unto him behold haman standeth court king said let him come 6 6 so haman came king said unto him what shall be done unto man whom king delighteth honour now haman thought hi heart whom would king delight do honour more than myself 6 7 haman answer king man whom king delighteth honour 6 8 let royal apparel be brought which king useth wear hors that king rideth crown royal which is set hi head 6 9 let thi apparel hors be deliv hand one king s most nobl princ that they may array man withal whom king delighteth honour bring him horseback street citi proclaim him thu shall it be done man whom king delighteth honour 6 10 then king said haman make hast take apparel hors as thou hast said do even so mordecai jew that sitteth king s gate let noth fail all that thou hast spoken 6 11 then took haman apparel hors array mordecai brought him horseback street citi proclaim him thu shall it be done unto man whom king delighteth honour 6 12 mordecai came again king s gate but haman hast hi hous mourn have hi head cover 6 13 haman told zeresh hi wife all hi friend everi thing that had befallen him then said hi wise men zeresh hi wife unto him if mordecai be seed jew whom thou hast begun fall thou shalt not prevail against him but shalt sure fall him 6 14 while they were yet talk him came king s chamberlain hast bring haman unto banquet that esther had prepar 7 1 so king haman came banquet esther queen 7 2 king said again unto esther second day banquet wine what is thi petit queen esther it shall be grant thee what is thi request it shall be perform even half kingdom 7 3 then esther queen answer said if i have found favour thi sight o king if it pleas king let my life be given me my petit my peopl my request 7 4 we are sold i my peopl be destroy be slain perish but if we had been sold bondmen bondwomen i had held my tongu although enemi could not countervail king s damag 7 5 then king ahasueru answer said unto esther queen who is he where is he that durst presum hi heart do so 7 6 esther said adversari enemi is thi wick haman then haman wa afraid king queen 7 7 king aris banquet wine hi wrath went palac garden haman stood make request hi life esther queen he saw that there wa evil determin against him king 7 8 then king return palac garden place banquet wine haman wa fallen bed whereon esther wa then said king will he forc queen also me hous as word went king s mouth they cover haman s face 7 9 harbonah one chamberlain said king behold also gallow fifti cubit high which haman had made mordecai who spoken good king standeth hous haman then king said hang him thereon 7 10 so they hang haman gallow that he had prepar mordecai then wa king s wrath pacifi 8 1 that day did king ahasueru give hous haman jew enemi unto esther queen mordecai came king esther had told what he wa unto her 8 2 king took off hi ring which he had taken haman gave it unto mordecai esther set mordecai hous haman 8 3 esther spake yet again king fell down hi feet besought him tear put away mischief haman agagit hi devic that he had devis against jew 8 4 then king held golden sceptr esther so esther aros stood king 8 5 said if it pleas king if i have favour hi sight thing seem right king i be pleas hi eye let it be written revers letter devis haman son hammedatha agagit which he wrote destroy jew which are all king s provinc 8 6 how can i endur gallow becaus he laid hi hand jew 8 8 write ye also jew as it liketh you king s name seal it king s ring write which is written king s name seal king s ring may no man revers 8 9 then were king s scribe call that time third month that is month sivan three twentieth day thereof it wa written accord all that mordecai command unto jew lieuten deputi ruler provinc which are india unto ethiopia retain rich 11 17 merci man doeth good hi own soul but he that is cruel troubleth hi own flesh 11 18 wick worketh deceit work but him that soweth righteous shall be sure reward 11 19 as righteous wise 11 31 behold righteou shall be recompens earth much more wick sinner 12 1 whoso loveth instruct loveth knowledg but he that hateth reproof is brutish 12 2 good man obtaineth favour lord but man wick devic will he condemn 12 3 man shall not be establish wicked but root righteou shall not be move 12 4 virtuou woman is crown her husband but she that maketh asham is as rotten hi bone 12 5 shall be commend accord hi wisdom but he that is pervers heart shall be despis 12 9 he that is despis hath servant is better than he that honoureth himself lacketh bread 12 10 righteou man regardeth righteou yieldeth fruit 12 13 wick is snare transgress hi lip but just shall come troubl 12 14 man shall be satisfi good fruit hi mouth recomp man s hand shall be render unto him 12 15 way fool is peac is joy 12 21 there shall no evil happen just but wick shall be fill mischief 12 22 lie lip are abomin lord but they that deal truli are hi delight 12 23 prudent man concealeth knowledg but heart fool proclaimeth foolish 12 24 hand dilig shall bear rule but sloth shall be tribut 12 25 heavi heart man maketh it stoop but good word maketh it glad 12 26 righteou is more excel than hi neighbour but way wick seduceth them 12 27 sloth man roasteth not that which he took hunt but substanc dilig man is preciou 12 28 way righteous is life pathway thereof there is no death 13 1 wise son heareth hi father s instruct but scorner heareth not rebuk 13 2 man shall eat good fruit hi mouth but soul transgressor shall eat violenc 13 3 he that keepeth hi mouth keepeth hi life but he that openeth wide hi lip shall have destruct 13 4 soul sluggard desireth hath noth but soul dilig shall be made fat 13 5 righteou man hateth lie but wick man is loathsom cometh shame 13 6 righteous keepeth him that is upright way but wicked overthroweth sinner 13 7 there is that maketh himself rich yet hath noth there is that maketh himself poor yet hath great rich 13 8 ransom man s life are hi rich but poor heareth not rebuk 13 9 light righteou rejoiceth but lamp wick shall be put 13 10 onli pride cometh content but well advis is wisdom 13 11 wealth gotten vaniti shall be diminish but he that gathereth labour shall increas 13 12 hope defer maketh heart sick but when desir cometh it is tree life 13 13 whoso despiseth word shall be destroy but he that feareth command shall be reward 13 14 law wise is fountain life depart snare death 13 15 good understand giveth favour but way transgressor is hard 13 16 everi prudent man dealeth knowledg but fool layeth open hi folli 13 17 wick messeng falleth mischief but faith ambassador is health 13 18 poverti shame shall be him that refuseth instruct but he that regardeth reproof shall be honour 13 19 desir accomplish is sweet soul but it is abomin fool children wealth sinner is laid just 13 23 much food is tillag poor but there is that is destroy want judgment 13 24 he that spareth hi rod hateth hi son but he that loveth him chasteneth him betim 13 man 27 20 hell destruct are never full so eye man are never satisfi 27 21 as fine pot silver furnac gold so is man hi prais 27 22 though thou shouldest bray fool mortar wheat pestl yet will not hi foolish depart him 27 23 be thou dilig know state thi flock look well thi herd 27 24 rich are not ever doth crown endur everi gener 27 25 hay appeareth tender grass sheweth itself herb mountain are gather 27 26 lamb are thi cloth goat are price field 27 27 thou shalt have goat milk enough thi food food thi household mainten thi maiden 28 1 wick flee when no man pursueth but righteou are bold as lion 28 2 transgress land mani are princ thereof but man understand knowledg state thereof shall be prolong 28 3 poor man that oppresseth poor is like sweep rain which leaveth no food 28 4 they that forsak law prais wick but such as keep law contend them 28 5 evil men understand not judgment but they that seek lord understand all thing 28 6 better is poor that walketh hi upright than he that is pervers hi way though he be rich 28 7 whoso keepeth law is wise son but he that is companion riotou men shameth hi father 28 8 he that usuri unjust gain increaseth hi substanc he shall gather it him that will piti poor 28 9 he that turneth away hi ear hear law even hi prayer shall be abomin 28 10 whoso causeth righteou go astray evil way he shall fall himself hi own pit but upright shall have good thing possess 28 11 rich man is wise hi own conceit but poor that hath understand searcheth him 28 12 when righteou men do rejoic there is great glori but when wick rise man is hidden 28 13 he that covereth hi sin shall not prosper but whoso confesseth forsaketh them shall have merci 28 14 happi is man that feareth alway but he that hardeneth hi heart shall fall mischief 28 15 as roar lion rang bear so is wick ruler poor peopl 28 16 princ that wanteth understand is also great oppressor but he that hateth covet shall prolong hi day 28 17 man that doeth violenc blood ani person shall flee pit let no man stay him 28 18 whoso walketh uprightli shall be save but he that is pervers hi way shall fall onc 28 19 he that tilleth hi land shall have plenti bread but he that followeth vain person shall have poverti enough 28 20 faith man shall abound bless but he that maketh hast be rich shall not be innoc 28 21 have respect person is not good piec bread that man will transgress 28 22 he that hasteth be rich hath evil eye considereth not that poverti shall come him 28 23 he that rebuketh man afterward shall find more favour than he that flattereth tongu 28 24 whoso robbeth hi father or hi mother saith it is no transgress same is companion destroy 28 25 he that is proud heart stirreth strife but he that putteth hi trust lord shall be made fat 28 26 he that trusteth hi own heart is fool but whoso walketh wise he shall be deliv 28 27 he that giveth unto poor shall not lack but he that hideth hi eye shall have mani curs 28 28 when wick rise men hide themselv but when they perish righteou increas 29 1 he that be often reprov hardeneth hi neck shall suddenli be destroy that remedi 29 2 when righteou are author peopl rejoic but when wick beareth rule peopl mourn 29 3 whoso loveth wisdom rejoiceth hi father but he that keepeth compani harlot spendeth hi substanc 29 4 king judgment establisheth land but he that receiveth gift overthroweth it 29 5 man that flattereth hi neighbour spreadeth net hi feet 29 6 transgress evil man there is snare but righteou doth sing rejoic 29 7 righteou considereth caus poor but wick regardeth not know it 29 8 scorn men bring citi snare but wise men turn away wrath 29 9 if wise man contendeth foolish man he rage or laugh there is no rest 29 10 bloodthirsti hate upright but just seek hi soul 29 11 fool uttereth all hi mind but wise man keepeth it till afterward 29 12 if ruler hearken lie all hi servant are wick 29 13 poor deceit man meet togeth lord lighteneth both their eye 29 14 king that faith judgeth poor hi throne shall be establish ever 29 15 rod reproof give wisdom but child left himself bringeth hi mother shame 29 16 when wick are multipli transgress increaseth but righteou shall see their fall 29 17 correct thi son he shall give thee rest yea he shall give delight unto thi soul 29 18 where there is no vision peopl perish but he that keepeth law happi is he 29 19 servant will not be correct word though he understand he will not answer 29 20 seest thou man that is hasti hi word there is more hope fool than him 29 21 he that delic bringeth hi servant child shall have him becom hi son length 29 22 angri man stirreth strife furiou man aboundeth transgress 29 23 man s pride shall bring him low but honour shall uphold humbl spirit 29 24 whoso is partner thief hateth hi own soul he heareth curs bewrayeth it not 29 25 fear man bringeth snare but whoso putteth hi trust lord shall be safe 29 26 mani seek ruler s favour but everi man s judgment cometh lord 29 27 unjust man is abomin just he that is upright way is abomin wick 30 1 word agur son jakeh even propheci man spake unto ithiel even unto ithiel ucal 30 2 sure i am more brutish than ani man have not understand man 30 3 i neither learn wisdom nor have knowledg holi 30 4 who hath ascend heaven or descend who hath gather wind hi fist who hath bound water garment who hath establish all end earth what is hi name what is hi son s name if thou canst tell 30 5 everi word god is pure he is shield unto them that put their trust him 30 6 add thou not unto hi word lest he reprov thee thou be found liar 30 7 two thing have i requir thee deni me them not i die 30 8 remov far me vaniti lie give me neither poverti nor rich feed me food conveni me 30 9 lest i be full deni thee say who is lord or lest i be poor steal take name my god vain 30 king against whom there is no rise 30 32 if thou hast done foolishli lift thyself or if thou hast thought evil lay thine hand thi mouth 30 33 sure churn milk bringeth forth butter wring nose bringeth mouth judg righteous plead caus poor needi 31 10 who can find virtuou woman her price is far rubi 31 11 heart her husband doth safe trust her so that he shall have no need spoil 31 12 she will do him good not evil all day her life 31 13 she seeketh wool flax worketh willingli her hand 31 14 she is like merchant ship she bringeth her food afar 31 15 she riseth also while it is yet night giveth meat her household portion her maiden 31 16 she considereth field buyeth it fruit her hand she planteth vineyard 31 17 she girdeth her loin strength strengtheneth her arm 31 18 she perceiveth that her merchandis is good her candl goeth not night 31 19 she layeth her hand spindl her hand hold distaff 31 20 she stretcheth her hand poor yea she reacheth forth her hand needi 31 21 she is not afraid snow her household all her household are cloth scarlet 31 22 she maketh herself cover tapestri her cloth is silk purpl 31 23 her husband is known gate when he sitteth elder land 31 24 she maketh fine linen selleth it delivereth girdl unto merchant 31 25 strength honour are her cloth she shall rejoic time come 31 26 she openeth her mouth wisdom her tongu is law kind 31 27 she looketh well way her household eateth not bread idl 31 28 her children aris call her bless her husband also he praiseth her 31 29 mani daughter have done virtuous but thou excellest them all 31 30 favour is deceit beauti river come thither they return again 1 8 all thing are full labour man cannot utter it eye is not satisfi see nor ear fill hear 1 9 thing that hath been it is that which shall be that which is done is all kind fruit 2 6 i made me pool water water therewith wood that bringeth forth tree 2 7 i got me servant maiden had servant born my hous also i had great possess great small cattl all that were that were me jerusalem also my wisdom remain me 2 10 whatsoev mine eye desir i kept not them i withheld not my heart ani joy my heart rejoic all my labour thi wa my portion all my labour 2 11 then i look all work that my hand had wrought labour that i had labour do behold all wa vaniti vexat spirit there wa no profit sun 2 12 i turn myself behold wisdom mad folli what can man do that cometh king even that which hath been alreadi done 2 13 then i saw that wisdom excelleth folli as far as light excelleth dark 2 14 wise man s eye are hi head but fool walketh dark i myself perceiv also that one event happeneth them all 2 15 then said i my heart as it happeneth fool so it happeneth even me whi wa i then more wise then i said my heart that thi also is vaniti 2 16 there is no remembr wise more than fool ever see that which now is day come shall all be forgotten how dieth wise man as fool 2 17 therefor i hate life becaus work that is wrought sun is grievou unto me all is vaniti vexat spirit night my bed i sought him whom my soul loveth i sought him but i found him not 3 2 i will rise now go citi street broad way i will seek him whom my soul loveth i sought him but i found him not 3 3 belov 5 2 i sleep but my heart waketh it is voic my belov that knocketh say open me my sister my love my dove my undefil my head is fill dew my lock drop night 5 3 i have put off my coat how shall i roe that are twin 7 4 thi neck is as tower ivori thine eye like fishpool heshbon gate bathrabbim thi nose is as tower lebanon which looketh damascu 7 5 thine head thee is like carmel hair thine head s hi desir is me 7 11 come my belov let us go forth field let us lodg villag 7 12 let us get earli vineyard let us see if vine flourish tender grape appear pomegran bud forth there will i give thee my would kiss thee yea i should not be despis 8 2 i would lead thee bring thee my mother s hous who would instruct me i would caus thee drink spice wine juic my pomegran 8 3 hi left hand should be my which hath most vehement flame 8 7 mani water cannot quench love neither can flood drown it if man would give all substanc hi hous love it would utterli be contemn 8 8 we have littl sister she hath no mountain spice book prophet isaiah 1 1 vision isaiah son amoz which he saw concern judah jerusalem day uzziah jotham ahaz hezekiah king judah 1 2 hear o heaven give ear o earth lord hath spoken i have nourish brought children they have rebel against me 1 3 ox knoweth hi owner ass hi master s crib but israel doth not know my peopl doth not consid 1 4 ah sin nation peopl laden iniqu seed evildo children that are corrupt they have forsaken lord they have provok holi one israel unto anger they are gone away backward 1 5 whi should ye be stricken ani more ye will revolt more more whole head is sick whole heart faint 1 6 sole foot even unto head there is no sound it but wound bruis putrifi sore they have not been close neither bound neither mollifi ointment 1 7 your countri is desol your citi are burn fire your land stranger devour it your presenc it is desol as overthrown stranger 1 8 daughter zion is left as cottag vineyard as lodg garden cucumb as besieg citi 1 9 lord host had left unto us veri small remnant we should have been as sodom we should have been like unto gomorrah 1 10 hear word lord ye ruler sodom give ear unto law our god ye peopl gomorrah 1 11 what purpos is multitud your sacrific unto me saith lord i am full burnt offer ram fat fed beast i delight not blood bullock or lamb or he goat 1 12 when ye come appear me who hath requir thi your hand tread my court 1 13 bring no more vain oblat incens is abomin unto me new moon sabbath call assembl i cannot away it is iniqu even solemn meet 1 14 your new moon your appoint feast my soul hateth they are troubl unto me i am weari bear them 1 15 when ye spread forth your hand i will hide mine eye you yea when ye make mani prayer i will not hear your hand are full blood 1 16 wash you make you clean put away evil your do mine eye ceas do evil 1 17 learn do well seek judgment reliev oppress judg fatherless plead widow 1 18 come now let us reason togeth saith lord though your sin be as scarlet they shall be as white as snow though they be red like crimson they shall be as wool 1 19 if ye be will obedi ye shall eat good land 1 20 but if ye refus rebel ye shall be devour sword mouth lord hath spoken it 1 21 how is faith citi becom harlot it wa full judgment righteous lodg it but now murder 1 22 thi silver is becom dross thi wine mix water 1 23 thi princ are rebelli companion thiev everi one loveth gift followeth reward they judg not fatherless neither doth caus widow come unto them 1 24 therefor saith lord lord host mighti one israel ah i will eas me mine adversari aveng me mine enemi 1 25 i will turn my hand thee pure purg away thi dross take away all thi tin 1 26 i will restor thi judg as first thi counsellor as begin afterward thou shalt be call citi righteous faith citi 1 27 zion shall be redeem judgment her convert righteous 1 28 destruct transgressor sinner shall be togeth they that forsak lord shall be consum 1 29 they shall be asham oak which ye have desir ye shall be confound garden that ye have chosen 1 30 ye shall be as oak whose leaf fadeth as garden that hath no water 1 31 strong shall be as tow maker it as spark they shall both burn togeth none shall quench them 2 1 word that isaiah son amoz saw concern judah jerusalem 2 2 it shall come pass last day that mountain lord s hous shall be establish top mountain shall be exalt hill all nation shall flow unto it 2 3 mani peopl shall go say come ye let us go mountain lord hous god jacob he will teach us hi way we will walk hi path zion shall go forth law word lord jerusalem 2 4 he shall judg nation shall rebuk mani peopl they shall beat their sword plowshar their spear pruninghook nation shall not lift sword against nation neither shall they learn war ani more 2 5 o hous jacob come ye let us walk light lord 2 6 therefor thou hast forsaken thi peopl hous jacob becaus they be replenish east are soothsay like philistin they pleas themselv children stranger 2 7 their land also is full silver gold neither is there ani end their treasur their land is also full hors neither is there ani end their chariot 2 8 their land also is full idol they worship work their own hand that which their own finger have made 2 9 mean man boweth down great man humbleth himself therefor forgiv them not 2 10 enter rock hide thee dust fear lord glori hi majesti 2 11 lofti look man shall be humbl haughti men shall be bow down lord alon shall be exalt that day 2 12 day lord host shall be everi one that is proud lofti everi one that is lift he shall be brought low 2 13 all cedar lebanon that are high lift all oak bashan 2 14 all high mountain all hill that are lift 2 15 everi high tower everi fenc wall 2 16 all ship tarshish all pleasant pictur 2 17 lofti man shall be bow down haughti men shall be made low lord alon shall be exalt that day 2 18 idol he shall utterli abolish 2 19 they shall go hole rock cave earth fear lord glori hi majesti when he ariseth shake terribl earth 2 20 that day man shall cast hi idol silver hi idol gold which they made each one himself worship mole bat 2 21 go cleft rock top rag rock fear lord glori hi majesti when he ariseth shake terribl earth 2 22 ceas ye man whose breath is hi nostril wherein is he be account 3 1 behold lord lord host doth take away jerusalem judah stay staff whole stay bread whole stay water 3 2 mighti man man war judg prophet prudent ancient 3 3 captain fifti honour man counsellor cun artific eloqu orat 3 4 i will give children be their princ babe shall rule them 3 5 peopl shall be oppress everi one anoth everi one hi neighbour child shall behav himself proudli against ancient base against honour 3 6 when man shall take hold hi brother hous hi father say thou hast cloth be thou our ruler let thi ruin be thi hand 3 7 that day shall he swear say i will not be healer my hous is neither bread nor cloth make me not ruler peopl 3 8 jerusalem is ruin judah is fallen becaus their tongu their do are against lord provok eye hi glori 3 9 shew their counten doth wit against them they declar their sin as sodom they hide it not woe unto their soul they have reward evil unto themselv 3 10 say ye righteou that it shall be well him they shall eat fruit their do 3 11 woe unto wick it shall be ill him reward hi hand shall be given him 3 12 as my peopl children are their oppressor women rule them o my peopl they which lead thee caus thee err destroy way thi path 3 13 lord standeth plead standeth judg peopl 3 14 lord will enter judgment ancient hi peopl princ thereof ye have eaten vineyard spoil poor is your hous 3 15 what mean ye that ye beat my peopl piec grind face poor saith lord god host 3 16 moreov lord saith becaus daughter zion are haughti walk stretch forth neck wanton eye walk minc as they go make tinkl their feet 3 17 therefor lord will smite scab crown head daughter zion lord will discov their secret part 3 18 that day lord will take away braveri their tinkl ornament their feet their caul their round tire like moon 3 19 chain bracelet muffler 3 20 bonnet ornament leg headband tablet ear 3 21 ring nose jewel 3 22 changeabl suit apparel mantl wimpl crisp pin 3 23 glass fine linen hood vail 3 24 it shall come pass that instead sweet smell there shall be stink instead girdl rent instead well set hair bald instead stomach gird sackcloth burn instead beauti 3 25 thi men shall fall sword thi mighti war 3 26 her gate shall lament mourn she be desol shall sit ground 4 1 that day seven women shall take hold one man say we will eat our own bread wear our own apparel onli let us be call thi name take away our reproach 4 2 that day shall branch lord be beauti gloriou fruit earth shall be excel come them that are escap israel 4 3 it shall come pass that he that is left zion he that remaineth jerusalem shall be call holi even everi one that is written live jerusalem 4 4 when lord shall have wash away filth daughter zion shall have purg blood jerusalem midst thereof spirit judgment spirit burn 4 5 lord will creat everi dwell place mount zion her assembl cloud smoke day shine flame fire night all glori shall be defenc 4 6 there shall be tabernacl shadow day time heat place refug covert storm rain 5 1 now will i sing my wellbelov song my belov touch hi vineyard my wellbelov hath vineyard veri fruit hill 5 2 he fenc it gather stone thereof plant it choicest vine built tower midst it also made winepress therein he look that it should bring forth grape it brought forth wild grape 5 3 now o inhabit jerusalem men judah judg i pray you betwixt me my vineyard 5 4 what could have been done more my vineyard that i have not done it wherefor when i look that it should bring forth grape brought it forth wild grape 5 5 now go i will tell you what i will do my vineyard i will take away hedg thereof it shall be eaten break down wall thereof it shall be trodden down 5 6 i will lay it wast it shall not be prune nor dig but there shall come brier thorn i will also command cloud that they rain no rain it 5 7 vineyard lord host is hous israel men judah hi pleasant plant he look judgment but behold oppress righteous but behold cri 5 8 woe unto them that join hous hous that lay field field till there be no place that they may be place alon midst earth 5 9 mine ear said lord host truth mani hous shall be desol even great fair inhabit 5 10 yea ten acr vineyard shall yield one bath seed homer shall yield ephah 5 11 woe unto them that rise earli morn that they may follow strong drink that continu night till wine inflam them 5 12 harp viol tabret pipe wine are their feast but they regard not work lord neither consid oper hi hand 5 13 therefor my peopl are gone captiv becaus they have no knowledg their honour men are famish their multitud dri thirst 5 14 therefor hell hath enlarg herself open her mouth measur their glori their multitud their pomp he that rejoiceth shall descend it 5 15 mean man shall be brought down mighti man shall be humbl eye lofti shall be humbl 5 16 but lord host shall be exalt judgment god that is holi shall be sanctifi righteous 5 17 then shall lamb feed their manner wast place fat one shall stranger eat 5 18 woe unto them that draw iniqu cord vaniti sin as it were cart rope 5 19 that say let him make speed hasten hi work that we may see it let counsel holi one israel draw nigh come that we may know it 5 20 woe unto them that call evil good good evil that put dark light light dark that put bitter sweet sweet bitter 5 21 woe unto them that are wise their own eye prudent their own sight 5 22 woe unto them that are mighti drink wine men strength mingl strong drink 5 23 which justifi wick reward take away righteous righteou him 5 24 therefor as fire devoureth stubbl flame consumeth chaff so their root shall be as rotten their blossom shall go as dust becaus they have cast away law lord host despis word holi one israel 5 25 therefor is anger lord kindl against hi peopl he hath stretch forth hi hand against them hath smitten them hill did trembl their carcas were torn midst street all thi hi anger is not turn away but hi hand is stretch still 5 26 he will lift ensign nation far will hiss unto them end earth behold they shall come speed swiftli 5 27 none shall be weari nor stumbl them none shall slumber nor sleep neither shall girdl their loin be loos nor latchet their shoe be broken 5 28 whose arrow are sharp all their bow bent their hors hoof shall be count like flint their wheel like whirlwind 5 29 their roar shall be like lion they shall roar like young lion yea they shall roar lay hold prey shall carri it away safe none shall deliv it 5 30 that day they shall roar against them like roar sea if one look unto land behold dark sorrow light is darken heaven thereof 6 1 year that king uzziah die i saw also lord sit throne high lift hi train fill templ 6 2 it stood seraphim each one had six wing twain he cover hi face twain he cover hi feet twain he did fli 6 3 one cri unto anoth said holi holi holi is lord host whole earth is full hi glori 6 4 post door move voic him that cri hous wa fill smoke 6 5 then said i woe is me i am undon becaus i am man unclean lip i dwell midst peopl unclean lip mine eye have seen king lord host 6 6 then flew one seraphim unto me have live coal hi hand which he had taken tong off altar 6 7 he laid it my mouth said lo thi hath touch thi lip thine iniqu is taken away thi sin purg 6 8 also i heard voic lord say whom shall i send who will go us then said i here am i send me 6 9 he said go tell thi peopl hear ye inde but understand not see ye inde but perceiv not 6 10 make heart thi peopl fat make their ear heavi shut their eye lest they see their eye hear their ear understand their heart convert be heal 6 11 then said i lord how long he answer citi be wast inhabit hous man land be utterli desol 6 12 lord have remov men far away there be great forsak midst land 6 13 but yet it shall be tenth it shall return shall be eaten as teil tree as oak whose substanc is them when they cast their leav so holi seed shall be substanc thereof 7 1 it came pass day ahaz son jotham son uzziah king judah that rezin king syria pekah son remaliah king israel went jerusalem war against it but could not prevail against it 7 2 it wa told hous david say syria is confeder ephraim hi heart wa move heart hi peopl as tree wood are move wind 7 they shall look unto earth behold troubl dark dim anguish they shall be driven dark 9 1 nevertheless dim shall not be such as wa her vexat when first he lightli afflict land zebulun land naphtali afterward did more grievous afflict her way sea jordan galile nation 9 2 peopl that walk dark have seen great light they that dwell land shadow death them hath light shine 9 3 thou hast multipli jacob it hath light israel 9 9 all peopl shall know even ephraim inhabit samaria that say pride stout heart 9 10 brick are fallen down but we will build hewn stone sycomor are cut down but we will hand is stretch still 9 13 peopl turneth not unto him that smiteth them neither do they seek lord host 9 14 therefor lord will cut off israel head tail branch rush one day 9 15 ancient honour he is head prophet that teacheth lie he is tail 9 16 leader thi peopl caus them err they that are led them are destroy 9 17 therefor lord shall have no joy their young men neither shall have merci their kindl thicket forest they shall mount like lift smoke 9 19 wrath lord host is land darken peopl shall be as fuel fire no man shall spare hi brother 9 20 he shall snatch right hand be hungri he shall eat left hand they shall not be satisfi they shall eat everi man flesh hi own arm 9 21 manasseh ephraim ephraim manasseh they togeth shall be against judah all thi hi anger is not turn away but hi hand is stretch still 10 1 woe unto them that decre unright decre that write grievous which they have prescrib 10 2 turn asid needi judgment take away right poor my peopl that widow may be their prey that they may rob fatherless 10 3 what will ye do day visit desol which shall come far whom will ye flee help where will ye leav your glori 10 4 me they shall bow down prison they shall fall slain all not my princ altogeth king 10 9 is not calno as carchemish is not hamath as arpad is not samaria as damascu 10 10 as my hand hath found kingdom idol whose graven imag did excel them jerusalem samaria 10 11 shall i not as i have done unto samaria her idol so do jerusalem her idol 10 12 wherefor it shall come pass that when lord hath perform hi whole work mount zion jerusalem i will punish fruit stout heart king assyria glori hi high look 10 13 he saith strength my hand i have done it my wisdom i am prudent i have remov bound peopl have rob their treasur i have put down inhabit like valiant man 10 14 my hand hath found as nest rich peopl as one gathereth egg that are left have i gather all earth there wa none that move wing or open mouth or peep 10 15 shall axe boast itself against him that heweth therewith or shall saw magnifi itself against him that shaketh it as if rod should shake itself against them that lift it or as if staff should lift itself as if it were no wood 10 16 shall consum glori hi forest hi fruit field both soul bodi they shall be as when standard bearer fainteth 10 19 rest tree hi forest shall be few that child may write them 10 20 it shall come pass that head fat valley shall be fade flower as hasti fruit summer which when he that looketh it seeth while it is yet hi hand he eateth it 28 5 that day shall lord host be crown glori diadem beauti unto residu hi peopl 28 6 spirit judgment him that sitteth judgment strength them that turn battl gate 28 7 but they also have er wine strong drink are way priest prophet have er strong drink they are swallow wine they are way strong drink they err vision they stumbl judgment 28 8 all tabl are full vomit filthi so that there is no place clean 28 9 whom shall he teach knowledg whom shall he make understand doctrin them that are wean milk drawn breast 28 10 precept must be precept precept precept line line line line here littl there littl 28 11 stammer lip anoth tongu will he speak thi peopl 28 12 whom he said thi is rest wherewith ye may caus weari rest thi is refresh yet they would not hear 28 13 but word lord wa unto them precept precept precept precept line line line line here littl there littl that they might go fall backward be broken snare taken 28 14 wherefor hear word lord ye scorn men that rule thi peopl which is jerusalem 28 15 becaus ye have said we have made coven death hell are we agreement when overflow scourg shall pass it shall not come unto us we have made lie our refug falsehood have we hid ourselv 28 16 therefor thu saith lord god behold i lay zion foundat stone tri stone preciou corner stone sure foundat he that believeth shall not make hast 28 17 judgment also will i lay line righteous plummet hail shall sweep away refug lie water shall overflow hide place 28 18 your coven death shall be disannul your agreement hell shall not stand when overflow scourg shall pass then ye shall be trodden down it 28 19 time that it goeth forth it shall take you morn morn shall it pass day night it shall be vexat onli understand report 28 20 bed is shorter than that man can stretch himself it cover narrow than that he can wrap himself it 28 21 lord shall rise as mount perazim he shall be wroth as valley gibeon that he may do hi work hi strang work bring pass hi act hi strang act 28 22 now therefor be ye not mocker lest your band be made strong i have heard lord god host consumpt even determin whole earth 28 23 give ye ear hear my voic hearken hear my speech 28 24 doth plowman plow all day sow doth he open break clod hi ground 28 25 when he hath made plain face thereof doth he not cast abroad fitch scatter cummin cast princip wheat appoint barley rie their place 28 26 hi god doth instruct him discret doth teach him 28 27 fitch are not thresh thresh instrument neither is cart wheel turn cummin but fitch are beaten staff cummin rod 28 28 bread corn is bruis becaus he will not ever be thresh it nor break it wheel hi cart nor bruis it hi horsemen 28 29 thi also cometh forth lord host which is wonder counsel excel work 29 1 woe ariel ariel citi where david dwelt add ye year year let them kill sacrific 29 2 yet i will distress ariel there shall be heavi sorrow it shall be unto me as ariel 29 3 i will camp against thee round will lay sieg against thee mount i will rais fort against thee 29 4 thou shalt be brought down shalt speak ground thi speech shall be low dust thi voic shall be as one that hath familiar spirit ground thi speech shall whisper dust 29 5 moreov multitud thi stranger shall be like small dust multitud terribl one shall be as chaff that passeth away yea it shall be instant suddenli 29 6 thou shalt be visit lord host thunder earthquak great nois storm tempest flame devour fire 29 7 multitud all nation that fight against ariel even all that fight against her her munit that distress her shall be as dream night vision 29 8 it shall even be as when hungri man dreameth behold he eateth but he awaketh hi soul is empti or as when thirsti man dreameth behold he drinketh but he awaketh behold he is faint hi soul hath appetit so shall multitud all nation be that fight against mount zion 29 9 stay yourselv wonder cri ye cri they are drunken but not wine they stagger but not strong drink 29 10 lord hath pour you spirit deep sleep hath close your eye prophet your ruler seer hath he cover 29 11 vision all is becom unto you as word book that is seal which men deliv one that is learn say read thi i pray thee he saith i cannot it is seal 29 12 book is deliv him that is not learn say read thi i pray thee he saith i am not learn 29 13 wherefor lord said forasmuch as thi peopl draw near me their mouth their lip do honour me but have remov their heart far me their fear me is taught precept men 29 14 therefor behold i will proceed do marvel work thi peopl even marvel work wonder wisdom their wise men shall perish understand their prudent men shall be hid 29 15 woe unto them that seek deep hide their counsel lord their work are dark they say who seeth us who knoweth us 29 16 sure your turn thing upsid down shall be esteem as potter s clay shall work say him that made it he made me not or shall thing frame say him that frame it he had no understand 29 17 is it not yet veri littl while lebanon shall be turn fruit field fruit field shall be esteem as forest 29 18 that day shall deaf hear word book eye blind shall see obscur dark 29 19 meek also shall increas their joy lord poor men shall rejoic holi one israel 29 20 terribl one is brought nought scorner is consum all that watch iniqu are cut off 29 21 that make man offend word lay snare him that reproveth gate turn asid just thing nought 29 22 therefor thu saith lord who redeem abraham concern hous jacob jacob shall not now be asham neither shall hi face now wax pale 29 23 but when he seeth hi children work mine hand midst him they shall sanctifi my name sanctifi holi one jacob shall fear god israel 29 24 they also that er spirit shall come understand they that murmur shall learn doctrin 30 1 woe rebelli children saith lord that take counsel but not me that cover cover but not my spirit that they may add sin sin 30 2 that walk go down egypt have not ask my mouth strengthen themselv strength pharaoh trust shadow egypt 30 3 therefor shall strength pharaoh be your shame trust shadow egypt your confus 30 4 hi princ were zoan hi ambassador came hane 30 5 they were all asham peopl that could not profit them nor be help nor profit but shame also reproach 30 6 burden beast south land troubl anguish whenc come young concern thi their strength is sit still 30 8 now go write it them tabl note it book that it may be time come ever ever 30 9 that thi is rebelli peopl lie children children that will not hear law lord 30 10 which say seer see not prophet prophesi not unto us right thing speak unto us smooth thing prophesi deceit 30 11 get you way turn asid path caus holi one israel ceas us 30 12 wherefor thu saith shall break it as break potter vessel that is broken piec he shall not spare so that there shall not be found burst it sherd take fire hearth or take water withal pit 30 15 thu saith lord god holi one israel return rest shall ye be save quiet confid shall be your strength ye would not 30 16 but ye said no we will flee hors therefor shall ye flee we will ride swift therefor shall they that pursu you be swift 30 17 one thousand shall flee rebuk one rebuk five shall ye flee till ye be left as beacon top mountain as ensign hill 30 18 therefor will lord wait that he may be graciou unto you therefor will he be exalt that he may have merci you lord is god judgment bless are all they that wait him 30 19 peopl shall dwell zion jerusalem thou shalt weep no more he will be veri graciou unto thee voic thi cri when he shall hear it he will answer thee 30 20 though lord give you bread advers water afflict yet shall not thi teacher be remov corner ani more but thine eye shall see thi teacher 30 21 thine ear shall hear word behind thee say thi is way walk ye it when ye turn right hand when ye turn left 30 22 ye shall defil also cover thi graven imag silver ornament thi molten imag gold thou shalt cast them away as menstruou cloth thou shalt say unto it get thee henc 30 23 then shall he give rain thi seed that thou shalt sow ground withal bread increas earth it shall be fat plenteou that day shall thi cattl feed larg pastur 30 24 oxen likewis young ass that ear ground shall eat clean provend which hath been winnow shovel fan 30 25 there shall be everi high mountain everi high hill river stream water day great slaughter when tower fall 30 26 moreov light moon shall be as light sun light sun shall be sevenfold as light seven day day that lord bindeth breach hi peopl healeth stroke their wound 30 27 behold name lord cometh far burn hi anger burden thereof is heavi hi lip are full indign hi tongu as devour fire 30 28 hi breath as overflow stream shall reach midst neck sift nation siev vaniti there shall be bridl jaw peopl caus them err 30 29 ye shall have song as night when holi solemn is kept glad heart as when one goeth pipe come mountain lord mighti one israel 30 30 thereof is fire much wood breath lord like stream brimston doth kindl it 31 1 woe them that go down egypt help stay hors trust chariot becaus they are mani horsemen becaus they are veri strong but they look not unto holi one israel neither seek lord 31 2 yet he also is wise will bring evil will not call back hi word but will aris against hous evildo against help them that work iniqu 31 3 now egyptian are men not god their hors flesh not spirit when lord shall stretch hi hand both he that helpeth shall fall he that is holpen shall fall down they all shall fail togeth 31 4 thu hath lord spoken unto me like as lion young lion roar hi prey when multitud shepherd is call forth against him he will not be afraid their voic nor abas himself nois them so shall lord host come down fight mount zion hill thereof 31 5 as bird fli so will lord host defend jerusalem defend also he will deliv it pass he will preserv it 31 6 turn ye unto him whom children israel have deepli revolt 31 7 that flee sword hi young men shall be discomfit 31 9 he shall pass hi strong hold fear hi princ shall be afraid ensign saith lord whose fire is zion hi furnac jerusalem 32 1 behold king shall reign righteous princ shall rule judgment 32 2 man shall be as hide place wind covert tempest as river water dri place as shadow great rock weari land 32 3 eye them that see shall not be dim ear them that citi shall be low low place 32 20 bless are ye that sow besid all water that send forth thither feet ox ass 33 1 woe thee that spoilest thou wast not spoil dealest treacher they dealt not treacher thee when thou shalt ceas spoil thou shalt be spoil when thou shalt make end deal treacher they shall deal treacher thee 33 2 o lord be graciou unto us we have wait thee be thou their arm everi morn our salvat also time troubl 33 3 nois tumult peopl fled lift thyself nation were scatter 33 4 your spoil shall be gather like gather caterpil as run fro locust shall he run them 33 5 lord is exalt he dwelleth high he hath fill zion judgment righteous 33 6 wisdom knowledg shall be stabil thi time strength salvat fear lord is hi treasur 33 7 behold their valiant one shall cri ambassador peac shall weep bitterli 33 8 highway lie wast wayfar man ceaseth he hath broken coven he hath despis citi he regardeth no man 33 9 earth mourneth languisheth lebanon is asham hewn down sharon is like wilder bashan carmel shake off their fruit 33 10 now will i rise saith lord now will i be exalt now will i lift myself 33 11 ye shall conceiv chaff ye shall bring forth stubbl your breath as fire shall devour you 33 12 peopl shall be as burn lime as thorn cut shall they be burn fire 33 13 hear ye that are far off what i have done ye that are near acknowledg my might 33 14 sinner zion are afraid fear hath surpris hypocrit who us shall dwell devour fire who us shall dwell everlast burn 33 15 he that walketh righteous speaketh uprightli he that despiseth gain oppress that shaketh hi hand hold bribe that stoppeth hi ear hear blood shutteth hi eye see evil 33 16 he shall dwell high hi place defenc shall be munit rock bread shall be given him hi water shall be sure 33 17 thine eye shall see king hi beauti they shall behold land that is veri far off 33 18 thine heart shall medit terror where is scribe where is receiv where is he that count tower 33 19 thou shalt not see fierc peopl peopl deeper speech than thou canst perceiv stammer tongu that thou canst not understand 33 20 look zion citi our solemn thine eye shall see jerusalem quiet habit tabernacl that shall not be taken down not one stake thereof shall ever be remov neither shall ani cord thereof be broken 33 21 but there gloriou lord will be unto us place broad river stream wherein shall go no galley oar neither shall gallant ship pass therebi 33 22 lord is our judg lord is our lawgiv lord is our king he will save us 33 23 thi tackl are loos they could not well strengthen their mast they could not spread sail then is prey great spoil divid lame take prey 33 24 inhabit shall not say i am sick peopl that dwell therein shall be forgiven their iniqu 34 1 come near ye nation hear hearken ye peopl let earth hear all that is therein world all thing that come forth it 34 2 indign lord is all nation hi furi all their armi he hath utterli destroy them he hath deliv them slaughter 34 3 their slain also shall be cast their stink shall come their carcas mountain shall be melt their blood 34 4 all host heaven shall be dissolv heaven shall be roll togeth as scroll all their host shall fall down as leaf falleth off vine as fall fig fig tree 34 5 my sword shall be bath heaven behold it shall come down idumea peopl my curs judgment 34 6 sword lord is fill blood it is made fat fat blood lamb goat fat kidney ram lord hath sacrific bozrah great slaughter land idumea 34 7 unicorn shall come down them bullock bull their land shall be soak blood their dust made fat fat 34 8 it is day lord s vengeanc year recomp controversi zion 34 9 stream thereof shall be turn pitch dust thereof brimston land thereof shall becom burn pitch 34 10 it shall not be quench night nor day smoke thereof shall go ever gener gener it shall lie wast none shall pass it ever ever 34 11 but cormor bittern shall possess it owl also raven shall dwell it he shall stretch it line confus stone empti 34 12 they shall call nobl thereof kingdom but none shall be there all her princ shall be noth 34 13 thorn shall come her palac nettl brambl fortress thereof it shall be habit dragon court owl 34 14 wild beast desert shall also meet wild beast island satyr shall cri hi fellow screech owl also shall rest there find herself place rest 34 15 there shall great owl make her nest lay hatch gather her shadow there shall vultur also be gather everi one her mate 34 16 seek ye book lord read no one these shall fail none shall want her mate my mouth it hath command hi spirit it hath gather them 34 17 he hath cast lot them hi hand hath divid it unto them line they shall possess it ever gener gener shall they dwell therein 35 1 wilder solitari place shall be glad them desert shall rejoic blossom as rose 35 2 it shall blossom abundantli rejoic even joy sing glori lebanon shall be given unto it excel carmel sharon they shall see glori lord excel our god 35 3 strengthen ye weak hand confirm feebl knee 35 4 say them that are fear heart be strong fear not behold your god will come vengeanc even god recomp he will come save you 35 5 then eye blind shall be open ear deaf shall be unstop 35 6 then shall lame man leap as hart tongu dumb sing wilder shall water break stream desert 35 7 parch ground shall becom pool thirsti land spring water habit dragon where each lay shall be grass reed rush 35 8 highway shall be there way it shall be call way holi unclean shall not pass it but it shall be those wayfar men though fool shall not err therein 35 9 no lion shall be there nor ani raven beast shall go thereon it shall not be found there but redeem shall walk there 35 10 ransom lord shall return come zion song everlast joy their head they shall obtain joy glad sorrow sigh shall flee away 36 1 now it came pass fourteenth year king hezekiah that sennacherib king assyria came against all defenc citi judah took them 36 2 king assyria sent rabshakeh lachish jerusalem unto king hezekiah great armi he stood conduit upper pool highway fuller s field 36 3 then came forth unto him eliakim hilkiah s son which wa hous shebna scribe joah asaph s son record 36 4 rabshakeh said unto them say ye now hezekiah thu saith great king king assyria what confid is thi wherein thou trustest 36 5 i say sayest thou but they are but vain word i have counsel strength war now whom dost thou trust that thou rebellest against me 36 6 lo thou trustest staff thi broken reed egypt whereon if man lean it will go hi hand pierc it so is pharaoh king egypt all that trust him 36 7 but if thou say me we trust lord our god is it not he whose high place whose altar hezekiah hath taken away said judah jerusalem ye shall worship thi altar 36 8 now therefor give pledg i pray thee my master king assyria i will give thee two thousand hors if thou be abl thi part set rider them 36 9 how then wilt thou turn away face one captain least my master s servant put thi trust egypt chariot horsemen 36 10 am i now come lord against thi land destroy it lord said unto me go against thi land destroy it 36 11 then said eliakim shebna joah unto rabshakeh speak i pray thee unto thi servant syrian languag we understand it speak not us jew languag ear peopl that are wall 36 12 but rabshakeh said hath my master sent me thi master thee speak these word hath he not sent me men that sit wall that they may eat their own dung drink their own piss you 36 13 then rabshakeh stood cri loud voic jew languag said hear ye word great king king assyria 36 14 thu saith king let not hezekiah deceiv you he shall not be abl deliv you 36 15 neither let hezekiah make you trust lord say lord will sure deliv us thi citi shall not be deliv hand king assyria 36 16 hearken not hezekiah thu saith king assyria make agreement me present come me eat ye everi one hi vine everi one hi fig tree drink ye everi one water hi own cistern 36 17 i come take you away land like your own land land corn wine land bread vineyard 36 18 bewar lest hezekiah persuad you say lord will ruinou heap 37 27 therefor their inhabit were small power they were dismay confound they were as grass field as green herb as grass housetop as corn blast it be grown 37 28 but i know thi abod thi go thi come thi rage against me 37 29 becaus thi rage against me thi tumult is come mine ear therefor will i put my hook thi nose my bridl thi lip i will turn thee back way which thou camest 37 30 thi shall be sign unto thee ye shall eat thi year such as groweth itself second year that which springeth same third year sow ye reap plant vineyard eat fruit thereof 37 31 remnant that is escap hous son reign hi stead 38 1 those day wa hezekiah sick unto death isaiah prophet son amoz came unto him said unto him thu saith lord set thine hous order thou shalt die not live 38 2 then hezekiah turn hi face wall pray unto lord 38 3 said rememb now o lord i beseech thee how i have walk thee truth perfect heart have done that which is good thi sight hezekiah wept sore 38 4 then came word lord isaiah
