prophet ruler synagogu sent unto them say ye men brethren if ye have ani word exhort peopl say 13 16 then paul stood beckon hi hand said men israel ye that fear god give audienc 13 17 god thi peopl israel chose our father exalt peopl when they dwelt as stranger land egypt high arm brought he them it 13 18 time forti year suffer he their manner wilder 13 19 when he had destroy seven nation land chanaan he divid their land them lot 13 20 that he gave unto them judg space four hundr fifti year samuel prophet 13 21 afterward they desir king god gave unto them saul son ci man tribe benjamin space forti year 13 22 when he had remov him he rais unto them david be their king whom also he gave their testimoni said i have found david son jess man mine own heart which shall fulfil all my will 13 23 thi man s seed hath god accord hi promis rais unto israel saviour jesu 13 24 when john had first preach hi come baptism repent all peopl israel 13 25 as john fulfil hi cours he said whom think ye that i am i am not he but behold there cometh one me whose shoe hi feet i am not worthi loos 13 26 men brethren children stock abraham whosoev you feareth god you is word thi salvat sent 13 27 they that dwell jerusalem their ruler becaus they knew him not nor yet voic prophet which are read everi sabbath day they have fulfil them condemn him 13 28 though they found no caus death him yet desir they pilat that he should be slain 13 29 when they had fulfil all that wa written him they took him down tree laid him sepulchr 13 30 but god rais him dead 13 31 he wa seen mani day them which came him galile jerusalem who are hi wit unto peopl 13 32 we declar unto you glad tide how that promis which wa made unto father 13 33 god hath fulfil same unto us their children that he hath rais jesu again as it is also written second psalm thou art my son thi day have i begotten thee 13 34 as concern that he rais him dead now no more return corrupt he said thi wise i will give you sure merci david 13 35 wherefor he saith also anoth psalm thou shalt not suffer thine holi one see corrupt 13 36 david he had serv hi own gener will god fell sleep wa laid unto hi father saw corrupt 13 37 but he whom god rais again saw no corrupt 13 38 be it known unto you therefor men brethren that thi man is preach unto you forgiv sin 13 39 him all that believ are justifi all thing which ye could not be justifi law mose 13 40 bewar therefor lest that come you which is spoken prophet 13 41 behold ye despis wonder perish i work work your day work which ye shall no wise believ though man declar it unto you 13 42 when jew were gone synagogu gentil besought that these word might be preach them next sabbath 13 43 now when congreg wa broken mani jew religi proselyt follow paul barnaba who speak them persuad them continu grace god 13 44 next sabbath day came almost whole citi togeth hear word god 13 45 but when jew saw multitud they were fill envi spake against those thing which were spoken paul contradict blasphem 13 46 then paul barnaba wax bold said it wa necessari that word god should first have been spoken you but see ye put it you judg yourselv unworthi everlast life lo we turn gentil 13 47 so hath lord command us say i have set thee be light gentil that thou shouldest be salvat unto end earth 13 48 when gentil heard thi they were glad glorifi word lord as mani as were ordain etern life believ 13 49 word lord wa publish all region 13 50 but jew stir devout honour women chief men citi rais persecut against paul barnaba expel them their coast 13 51 but they shook off dust their feet against them came unto iconium 13 52 discipl were fill joy holi ghost 14 1 it came pass iconium that they went both togeth synagogu jew so spake that great multitud both jew also greek believ 14 2 but unbeliev jew stir gentil made their mind evil affect against brethren 14 3 long time therefor abod they speak boldli lord which gave testimoni unto word hi grace grant sign wonder be done their hand 14 4 but multitud citi wa divid part held jew part apostl 14 5 when there wa assault made both gentil also jew their ruler use them despit stone them 14 6 they were ware it fled unto lystra derb citi lycaonia unto region that lieth round 14 7 there they preach gospel 14 8 there sat certain man lystra impot hi feet be crippl hi mother s womb who never had walk 14 9 same heard paul speak who stedfastli behold him perceiv that he had faith be heal 14 10 said loud voic stand upright thi feet he leap walk 14 11 when peopl saw what paul had done they lift their voic say speech lycaonia god are come down us like men 14 12 they call barnaba jupit paul mercuriu becaus he wa chief speaker 14 13 then priest jupit which wa their citi brought oxen garland unto gate would have done sacrific peopl 14 14 which when apostl barnaba paul heard they rent their cloth ran peopl cri 14 15 say sir whi do ye these thing we also are men like passion you preach unto you that ye should turn these vaniti unto live god which made heaven earth sea all thing that are therein 14 16 who time past suffer all nation walk their own way 14 17 nevertheless he left not himself wit that he did good gave us rain heaven fruit season fill our heart food glad 14 18 these say scarc restrain they peopl that they had not done sacrific unto them 14 19 there came thither certain jew antioch iconium who persuad peopl have stone paul drew him citi suppos he had been dead 14 20 howbeit as discipl stood round him he rose came citi next day he depart barnaba derb 14 21 when they had preach gospel that citi had taught mani they return again lystra iconium antioch 14 22 confirm soul discipl exhort them continu faith that we must much tribul enter kingdom god 14 23 when they had ordain them elder everi church had pray fast they commend them lord whom they believ 14 24 they had pass pisidia they came pamphylia 14 25 when they had preach word perga they went down attalia 14 26 thenc sail antioch whenc they had been recommend grace god work which they fulfil 14 27 when they were come had gather church togeth they rehears all that god had done them how he had open door faith unto gentil 14 28 there they abod long time discipl 15 1 certain men which came down judaea taught brethren said ye be circumcis manner mose ye cannot be save 15 2 when therefor paul barnaba had no small dissens disput them they determin that paul barnaba certain other them should go jerusalem unto apostl elder thi question 15 3 be brought their way church they pass phenic samaria declar convers gentil they caus great joy unto all brethren 15 4 when they were come jerusalem they were receiv church apostl elder they declar all thing that god had done them 15 5 but there rose certain sect pharise which believ say that it wa need circumcis them command them keep law mose 15 6 apostl elder came togeth consid thi matter 15 7 when there had been much disput peter rose said unto them men brethren ye know how that good while ago god made choic us that gentil my mouth should hear word gospel believ 15 8 god which knoweth heart bare them wit give them holi ghost even as he did unto us 15 9 put no differ us them purifi their heart faith 15 10 now therefor whi tempt ye god put yoke neck discipl which neither our father nor we were abl bear 15 11 but we believ that grace lord jesu christ we shall be save even as they 15 12 then all multitud kept silenc gave audienc barnaba paul declar what miracl wonder god had wrought gentil them 15 13 they had held their peac jame answer say men brethren hearken unto me 15 14 simeon hath declar how god first did visit gentil take them peopl hi name 15 15 thi agre word prophet as it is written 15 16 thi i will return will build again tabernacl david which is fallen down i will build again ruin thereof i will set it 15 17 that residu men might seek lord all gentil whom my name is call saith lord who doeth all these thing 15 18 known unto god are all hi work begin world 15 19 wherefor my sentenc is that we troubl not them which gentil are turn god 15 20 but that we write unto them that they abstain pollut idol fornic thing strangl blood 15 21 mose old time hath everi citi them that preach him be read synagogu everi sabbath day 15 22 then pleas it apostl elder whole church send chosen men their own compani antioch paul barnaba name juda surnam barsaba sila chief men brethren 15 23 they wrote letter them thi manner apostl elder brethren send greet unto brethren which are gentil antioch syria cilicia 15 24 forasmuch as we have heard that certain which went us have troubl you word subvert your soul say ye must be circumcis keep law whom we gave no such command 15 25 it seem good unto us be assembl one accord send chosen men unto you our belov barnaba paul 15 26 men that have hazard their live name our lord jesu christ 15 27 we have sent therefor juda sila who shall also tell you same thing mouth 15 28 it seem good holi ghost us lay you no greater burden than these necessari thing 15 29 that ye abstain meat offer idol blood thing strangl fornic which if ye keep yourselv ye shall do well fare ye well 15 30 so when they were dismiss they came antioch when they had gather multitud togeth they deliv epistl 15 31 which when they had read they rejoic consol 15 32 juda sila be prophet also themselv exhort brethren mani word confirm them 15 33 they had tarri there space they were let go peac brethren unto apostl 15 34 notwithstand it pleas sila abid there still 15 35 paul also barnaba continu antioch teach preach word lord mani other also 15 36 some day paul said unto barnaba let us go again visit our brethren everi citi where we have preach word lord see how they do 15 37 barnaba determin take them john whose surnam wa mark 15 38 but paul thought not good take him them who depart them pamphylia went not them work 15 39 content wa so sharp them that they depart asund one other so barnaba took mark sail unto cypru 15 40 paul chose sila depart be recommend brethren unto grace god 15 41 he went syria cilicia confirm church 16 1 then came he derb lystra behold certain discipl wa there name timotheu son certain woman which wa jewess believ but hi father wa greek 16 2 which wa well report brethren that were lystra iconium 16 3 him would paul have go forth him took circumcis him becaus jew which were those quarter they knew all that hi father wa greek 16 4 as they went citi they deliv them decre keep that were ordain apostl elder which were jerusalem 16 5 so were church establish faith increas number daili 16 6 now when they had gone phrygia region galatia were forbidden holi ghost preach word asia 16 7 they were come mysia they assay go bithynia but spirit suffer them not 16 8 they pass mysia came down troa 16 9 vision appear paul night there stood man macedonia pray him say come macedonia help us 16 10 he had seen vision immedi we endeavour go macedonia assuredli gather that lord had call us preach gospel unto them 16 11 therefor loos troa we came straight cours samothracia next day neapoli 16 12 thenc philippi which is chief citi that part macedonia coloni we were that citi abid certain day 16 13 sabbath we went citi river side where prayer wa wont be made we sat down spake unto women which resort thither 16 14 certain woman name lydia seller purpl citi thyatira which worship god heard us whose heart lord open that she attend unto thing which were spoken paul 16 15 when she wa baptiz her household she besought us say if ye have judg me be faith lord come my hous abid there she constrain us 16 16 it came pass as we went prayer certain damsel possess spirit divin met us which brought her master much gain soothsay 16 17 same follow paul us cri say these men are servant most high god which shew unto us way salvat 16 18 thi did she mani day but paul be griev turn said spirit i command thee name jesu christ come her he came same hour 16 19 when her master saw that hope their gain wa gone they caught paul sila drew them marketplac unto ruler 16 20 brought them magistr say these men be jew do exceedingli troubl our citi 16 21 teach custom which are not law us receiv neither observ be roman 16 22 multitud rose togeth against them magistr rent off their cloth command beat them 16 23 when they had laid mani stripe them they cast them prison charg jailor keep them safe 16 24 who have receiv such charg thrust them inner prison made their feet fast stock 16 25 midnight paul sila pray sang prais unto god prison heard them 16 26 suddenli there wa great earthquak so that foundat prison were shaken immedi all door were open everi one s band were loos 16 27 keeper prison awak hi sleep see prison door open he drew hi sword would have kill himself suppos that prison had been fled 16 28 but paul cri loud voic say do thyself no harm we are all here 16 29 then he call light sprang came trembl fell down paul sila 16 30 brought them said sir what must i do be save 16 31 they said believ lord jesu christ thou shalt be save thi hous 16 32 they spake unto him word lord all that were hi hous 16 33 he took them same hour night wash their stripe wa baptiz he all hi straightway 16 34 when he had brought them hi hous he set meat them rejoic believ god all hi hous 16 35 when it wa day magistr sent serjeant say let those men go 16 36 keeper prison told thi say paul magistr have sent let you go now therefor depart go peac 16 37 but paul said unto them they have beaten us openli uncondemn be roman have cast us prison now do they thrust us privili nay verili but let them come themselv fetch us 16 38 serjeant told these word unto magistr they fear when they heard that they were roman 16 39 they came besought them brought them desir them depart citi 16 40 they went prison enter hous lydia when they had seen brethren they comfort them depart 17 1 now when they had pass amphipoli apollonia they came thessalonica where wa synagogu jew 17 2 paul as hi manner wa went unto them three sabbath day reason them scriptur 17 3 open alleg that christ must need have suffer risen again dead that thi jesu whom i preach unto you is christ 17 4 some them believ consort paul sila devout greek great multitud chief women not few 17 5 but jew which believ not move envi took unto them certain lewd fellow baser sort gather compani set all citi uproar assault hous jason sought bring them peopl 17 6 when they found them not they drew jason certain brethren unto ruler citi cri these that have turn world upsid down are come hither also 17 7 whom jason hath receiv these all do contrari decre caesar say that there is anoth king one jesu 17 8 they troubl peopl ruler citi when they heard these thing 17 9 when they had taken secur jason other they let them go 17 10 brethren immedi sent away paul sila night unto berea who come thither went synagogu jew 17 11 these were more nobl than those thessalonica that they receiv word all readi mind search scriptur daili those thing were so 17 12 therefor mani them believ also honour women which were greek men not few 17 13 but when jew thessalonica had knowledg that word god wa preach paul berea they came thither also stir peopl 17 14 then immedi brethren sent away paul go as it were sea but sila timotheu abod there still 17 15 they that conduct paul brought him unto athen receiv command unto sila timotheu come him all speed they depart 17 16 now while paul wait them athen hi spirit wa stir him when he saw citi wholli given idolatri 17 17 therefor disput he synagogu jew devout person market daili them that met him 17 18 then certain philosoph epicurean stoick encount him some said what will thi babbler say other some he seemeth be setter forth strang god becaus he preach unto them jesu resurrect 17 19 they took him brought him unto areopagu say may we know what thi new doctrin whereof thou speakest is 17 20 thou bringest certain strang thing our ear we would know therefor what these thing mean 17 21 all athenian stranger which were there spent their time noth els but either tell or hear some new thing 17 22 then paul stood midst mar hill said ye men athen i perceiv that all thing ye are too superstiti 17 23 as i pass beheld your devot i found altar thi inscript unknown god whom therefor ye ignorantli worship him declar i unto you 17 24 god that made world all thing therein see that he is lord heaven earth dwelleth not templ made hand 17 25 neither is worship men s hand as though he need ani thing see he giveth all life breath all thing 17 26 hath made one blood all nation men dwell all face earth hath determin time appoint bound their habit 17 27 that they should seek lord if hapli they might feel him find him though he be not far everi one us 17 28 him we live move have our be as certain also your own poet have said we are also hi offspr 17 29 forasmuch then as we are offspr god we ought not think that godhead is like unto gold or silver or stone graven art man s devic 17 30 time thi ignor god wink but now commandeth all men everi where repent 17 31 becaus he hath appoint day which he will judg world righteous that man whom he hath ordain whereof he hath given assur unto all men that he hath rais him dead 17 32 when they heard resurrect dead some mock other said we will hear thee again thi matter 17 33 so paul depart them 17 34 howbeit certain men clave unto him believ which wa dionysiu areopagit woman name damari other them 18 1 these thing paul depart athen came corinth 18 2 found certain jew name aquila born pontu late come itali hi wife priscilla becaus that claudiu had command all jew depart rome came unto them 18 3 becaus he wa same craft he abod them wrought their occup they were tentmak 18 4 he reason synagogu everi sabbath persuad jew greek 18 5 when sila timotheu were come macedonia paul wa press spirit testifi jew that jesu wa christ 18 6 when they oppos themselv blasphem he shook hi raiment said unto them your blood be your own head i am clean henceforth i will go unto gentil 18 7 he depart thenc enter certain man s hous name justu one that worship god whose hous join hard synagogu 18 8 crispu chief ruler synagogu believ lord all hi hous mani corinthian hear believ were baptiz 18 9 then spake lord paul night vision be not afraid but speak hold not thi peac 18 10 i am thee no man shall set thee hurt thee i have much peopl thi citi 18 11 he continu there year six month teach word god them 18 12 when gallio wa deputi achaia jew made insurrect one accord against paul brought him judgment seat 18 13 say thi fellow persuadeth men worship god contrari law 18 14 when paul wa now open hi mouth gallio said unto jew if it were matter wrong or wick lewd o ye jew reason would that i should bear you 18 15 but if it be question word name your law look ye it i will be no judg such matter 18 16 he drave them judgment seat 18 17 then all greek took sosthen chief ruler synagogu beat him judgment seat gallio care none those thing 18 18 paul thi tarri there yet good while then took hi leav brethren sail thenc syria him priscilla aquila have shorn hi head cenchrea he had vow 18 19 he came ephesu left them there but he himself enter synagogu reason jew 18 20 when they desir him tarri longer time them he consent not 18 21 but bade them farewel say i must all mean keep thi feast that cometh jerusalem but i will return again unto you if god will he sail ephesu 18 22 when he had land caesarea gone salut church he went down antioch 18 23 he had spent some time there he depart went all countri galatia phrygia order strengthen all discipl 18 24 certain jew name apollo born alexandria eloqu man mighti scriptur came ephesu 18 25 thi man wa instruct way lord be fervent spirit he spake taught dilig thing lord know onli baptism john 18 26 he began speak boldli synagogu whom when aquila priscilla had heard they took him unto them expound unto him way god more perfectli 18 27 when he wa dispos pass achaia brethren wrote exhort discipl receiv him who when he wa come help them much which had believ grace 18 28 he mightili convinc jew that publickli shew scriptur that jesu wa christ 19 1 it came pass that while apollo wa corinth paul have pass upper coast came ephesu find certain discipl 19 2 he said unto them have ye receiv holi ghost ye believ they said unto him we have not so much as heard there be ani holi ghost 19 3 he said unto them unto what then were ye baptiz they said unto john s baptism 19 4 then said paul john verili baptiz baptism repent say unto peopl that they should believ him which should come him that is christ jesu 19 5 when they heard thi they were baptiz name lord jesu 19 6 when paul had laid hi hand them holi ghost came them they spake tongu prophesi 19 7 all men were twelv 19 8 he went synagogu spake boldli space three month disput persuad thing concern kingdom god 19 9 but when diver were harden believ not but spake evil that way multitud he depart them separ discipl disput daili school one tyrannu 19 10 thi continu space two year so that all they which dwelt asia heard word lord jesu both jew greek 19 11 god wrought special miracl hand paul 19 12 so that hi bodi were brought unto sick handkerchief or apron diseas depart them evil spirit went them 19 13 then certain vagabond jew exorcist took them call them which had evil spirit name lord jesu say we adjur you jesu whom paul preacheth 19 14 there were seven son one sceva jew chief priest which did so 19 15 evil spirit answer said jesu i know paul i know but who are ye 19 16 man whom evil spirit wa leap them overcam them prevail against them so that they fled that hous nake wound 19 17 thi wa known all jew greek also dwell ephesu fear fell them all name lord jesu wa magnifi 19 18 mani that believ came confess shew their deed 19 19 mani them also which use curiou art brought their book togeth burn them all men they count price them found it fifti thousand piec silver 19 20 so mightili grew word god prevail 19 21 these thing were end paul purpos spirit when he had pass macedonia achaia go jerusalem say i have been there i must also see rome 19 22 so he sent macedonia two them that minist unto him timotheu erastu but he himself stay asia season 19 23 same time there aros no small stir that way 19 24 certain man name demetriu silversmith which made silver shrine diana brought no small gain unto craftsmen 19 25 whom he call togeth workmen like occup said sir ye know that thi craft we have our wealth 19 26 moreov ye see hear that not alon ephesu but almost all asia thi paul hath persuad turn away much peopl say that they be no god which are made hand 19 27 so that not onli thi our craft is danger be set nought but also that templ great goddess diana should be despis her magnific should be destroy whom all asia world worshippeth 19 28 when they heard these say they were full wrath cri say great is diana ephesian 19 29 whole citi wa fill confus have caught gaiu aristarchu men macedonia paul s companion travel they rush one accord theatr 19 30 when paul would have enter unto peopl discipl suffer him not 19 31 certain chief asia which were hi friend sent unto him desir him that he would not adventur himself theatr 19 32 some therefor cri one thing some anoth assembl wa confus more part knew not wherefor they were come togeth 19 33 they drew alexand multitud jew put him forward alexand beckon hand would have made hi defenc unto peopl 19 34 but when they knew that he wa jew all one voic space two hour cri great is diana ephesian 19 35 when townclerk had appeas peopl he said ye men ephesu what man is there that knoweth not how that citi ephesian is worshipp great goddess diana imag which fell down jupit 19 36 see then that these thing cannot be spoken against ye ought be quiet do noth rashli 19 37 ye have brought hither these men which are neither robber church nor yet blasphem your goddess 19 38 wherefor if demetriu craftsmen which are him have matter against ani man law is open there are deputi let them implead one anoth 19 39 but if ye enquir ani thing concern other matter it shall be determin law assembl 19 40 we are danger be call question thi day s uproar there be no caus wherebi we may give account thi concours 19 41 when he had thu spoken he dismiss assembl 20 1 uproar wa ceas paul call unto him discipl embrac them depart go macedonia 20 2 when he had gone those part had given them much exhort he came greec 20 3 there abod three month when jew laid wait him as he wa sail syria he purpos return macedonia 20 4 there accompani him asia sopat berea thessalonian aristarchu secundu gaiu derb timotheu asia tychicu trophimu 20 5 these go tarri us troa 20 6 we sail away philippi day unleaven bread came unto them troa five day where we abod seven day 20 7 first day week when discipl came togeth break bread paul preach unto them readi depart morrow continu hi speech midnight 20 8 there were mani light upper chamber where they were gather togeth 20 9 there sat window certain young man name eutychu be fallen deep sleep as paul wa long preach he sunk down sleep fell down third loft wa taken dead 20 10 paul went down fell him embrac him said troubl not yourselv hi life is him 20 11 when he therefor wa come again had broken bread eaten talk long while even till break day so he depart 20 12 they brought young man aliv were not littl comfort 20 13 we went ship sail unto asso there intend take paul so had he appoint mind himself go afoot 20 14 when he met us asso we took him came mitylen 20 15 we sail thenc came next day against chio next day we arriv samo tarri trogyllium next day we came miletu 20 16 paul had determin sail ephesu becaus he would not spend time asia he hast if it were possibl him be jerusalem day pentecost 20 17 miletu he sent ephesu call elder church 20 18 when they were come him he said unto them ye know first day that i came asia what manner i have been you all season 20 19 serv lord all humil mind mani tear temptat which befel me lie wait jew 20 20 how i kept back noth that wa profit unto you but have shew you have taught you publickli hous hous 20 21 testifi both jew also greek repent god faith our lord jesu christ 20 22 now behold i go bound spirit unto jerusalem not know thing that shall befal me there 20 23 save that holi ghost witnesseth everi citi say that bond afflict abid me 20 24 but none these thing move me neither count i my life dear unto myself so that i might finish my cours joy ministri which i have receiv lord jesu testifi gospel grace god 20 25 now behold i know that ye all whom i have gone preach kingdom god shall see my face no more 20 26 wherefor i take you record thi day that i am pure blood all men 20 27 i have not shun declar unto you all counsel god 20 28 take heed therefor unto yourselv all flock which holi ghost hath made you overs feed church god which he hath purchas hi own blood 20 29 i know thi that my depart shall grievou wolv enter you not spare flock 20 30 also your own selv shall men aris speak pervers thing draw away discipl them 20 31 therefor watch rememb that space three year i ceas not warn everi one night day tear 20 32 now brethren i commend you god word hi grace which is abl build you give you inherit all them which are sanctifi 20 33 i have covet no man s silver or gold or apparel 20 34 yea ye yourselv know that these hand have minist unto my necess them that were me 20 35 i have shew you all thing how that so labour ye ought support weak rememb word lord jesu how he said it is more bless give than receiv 20 36 when he had thu spoken he kneel down pray them all 20 37 they all wept sore fell paul s neck kiss him 20 38 sorrow most all word which he spake that they should see hi face no more they accompani him unto ship 21 1 it came pass that we were gotten them had launch we came straight cours unto coo day follow unto rhode thenc unto patara 21 2 find ship sail unto phenicia we went aboard set forth 21 3 now when we had discov cypru we left it left hand sail syria land tyre there ship wa unlad her burden 21 4 find discipl we tarri there seven day who said paul spirit that he should not go jerusalem 21 5 when we had accomplish those day we depart went our way they all brought us our way wive children till we were citi we kneel down shore pray 21 6 when we had taken our leav one anoth we took ship they return home again 21 7 when we had finish our cours tyre we came ptolemai salut brethren abod them one day 21 8 next day we that were paul s compani depart came unto caesarea we enter hous philip evangelist which wa one seven abod him 21 9 same man had four daughter virgin which did prophesi 21 10 as we tarri there mani day there came down judaea certain prophet name agabu 21 11 when he wa come unto us he took paul s girdl bound hi own hand feet said thu saith holi ghost so shall jew jerusalem bind man that owneth thi girdl shall deliv him hand gentil 21 12 when we heard these thing both we they that place besought him not go jerusalem 21 13 then paul answer what mean ye weep break mine heart i am readi not be bound onli but also die jerusalem name lord jesu 21 14 when he would not be persuad we ceas say will lord be done 21 15 those day we took our carriag went jerusalem 21 16 there went us also certain discipl caesarea brought them one mnason cypru old discipl whom we should lodg 21 17 when we were come jerusalem brethren receiv us gladli 21 18 day follow paul went us unto jame all elder were present 21 19 when he had salut them he declar particularli what thing god had wrought gentil hi ministri 21 20 when they heard it they glorifi lord said unto him thou seest brother how mani thousand jew there are which believ they are all zealou law 21 21 they are inform thee that thou teachest all jew which are gentil forsak mose say that they ought not circumcis their children neither walk custom 21 22 what is it therefor multitud must need come togeth they will hear that thou art come 21 23 do therefor thi that we say thee we have four men which have vow them 21 24 them take purifi thyself them be charg them that they may shave their head all may know that those thing whereof they were inform concern thee are noth but that thou thyself also walkest orderli keepest law 21 25 as touch gentil which believ we have written conclud that they observ no such thing save onli that they keep themselv thing offer idol blood strangl fornic 21 26 then paul took men next day purifi himself them enter templ signifi accomplish day purif that offer should be offer everi one them 21 27 when seven day were almost end jew which were asia when they saw him templ stir all peopl laid hand him 21 28 cri men israel help thi is man that teacheth all men everi where against peopl law thi place further brought greek also templ hath pollut thi holi place 21 29 they had seen him citi trophimu ephesian whom they suppos that paul had brought templ 21 30 all citi wa move peopl ran togeth they took paul drew him templ forthwith door were shut 21 31 as they went kill him tide came unto chief captain band that all jerusalem wa uproar 21 32 who immedi took soldier centurion ran down unto them when they saw chief captain soldier they left beat paul 21 33 then chief captain came near took him command him be bound two chain demand who he wa what he had done 21 34 some cri one thing some anoth multitud when he could not know certainti tumult he command him be carri castl 21 35 when he came stair so it wa that he wa born soldier violenc peopl 21 36 multitud peopl follow cri away him 21 37 as paul wa be led castl he said unto chief captain may i speak unto thee who said canst thou speak greek 21 38 art not thou that egyptian which these day madest uproar leddest wilder four thousand men that were murder 21 39 but paul said i am man which am jew tarsu citi cilicia citizen no mean citi i beseech thee suffer me speak unto peopl 21 40 when he had given him licenc paul stood stair beckon hand unto peopl when there wa made great silenc he spake unto them hebrew tongu say 22 1 men brethren father hear ye my defenc which i make now unto you 22 2 when they heard that he spake hebrew tongu them they kept more silenc he saith 22 3 i am verili man which am jew born tarsu citi cilicia yet brought thi citi feet gamaliel taught accord perfect manner law father wa zealou god as ye all are thi day 22 4 i persecut thi way unto death bind deliv prison both men women 22 5 as also high priest doth bear me wit all estat elder whom also i receiv letter unto brethren went damascu bring them which were there bound unto jerusalem be punish 22 6 it came pass that as i made my journey wa come nigh unto damascu noon suddenli there shone heaven great light round me 22 7 i fell unto ground heard voic say unto me saul saul whi persecutest thou me 22 8 i answer who art thou lord he said unto me i am jesu nazareth whom thou persecutest 22 9 they that were me saw inde light were afraid but they heard not voic him that spake me 22 10 i said what shall i do lord lord said unto me aris go damascu there it shall be told thee all thing which are appoint thee do 22 11 when i could not see glori that light be led hand them that were me i came damascu 22 12 one anania devout man accord law have good report all jew which dwelt there 22 13 came unto me stood said unto me brother saul receiv thi sight same hour i look him 22 14 he said god our father hath chosen thee that thou shouldest know hi will see that just one shouldest hear voic hi mouth 22 15 thou shalt be hi wit unto all men what thou hast seen heard 22 16 now whi tarriest thou aris be baptiz wash away thi sin call name lord 22 17 it came pass that when i wa come again jerusalem even while i pray templ i wa tranc 22 18 saw him say unto me make hast get thee quickli jerusalem they will not receiv thi testimoni concern me 22 19 i said lord they know that i imprison beat everi synagogu them that believ thee 22 20 when blood thi martyr stephen wa shed i also wa stand consent unto hi death kept raiment them that slew him 22 21 he said unto me depart i will send thee far henc unto gentil 22 22 they gave him audienc unto thi word then lift their voic said away such fellow earth it is not fit that he should live 22 23 as they cri cast off their cloth threw dust air 22 24 chief captain command him be brought castl bade that he should be examin scourg that he might know wherefor they cri so against him 22 25 as they bound him thong paul said unto centurion that stood is it law you scourg man that is roman uncondemn 22 26 when centurion heard that he went told chief captain say take heed what thou doest thi man is roman 22 27 then chief captain came said unto him tell me art thou roman he said yea 22 28 chief captain answer great sum obtain i thi freedom paul said but i wa free born 22 29 then straightway they depart him which should have examin him chief captain also wa afraid he knew that he wa roman becaus he had bound him 22 30 morrow becaus he would have known certainti wherefor he wa accus jew he loos him hi band command chief priest all their council appear brought paul down set him them 23 1 paul earnestli behold council said men brethren i have live all good conscienc god thi day 23 2 high priest anania command them that stood him smite him mouth 23 3 then said paul unto him god shall smite thee thou white wall sittest thou judg me law commandest me be smitten contrari law 23 4 they that stood said revilest thou god s high priest 23 5 then said paul i wist not brethren that he wa high priest it is written thou shalt not speak evil ruler thi peopl 23 6 but when paul perceiv that one part were sadduce other pharise he cri council men brethren i am pharise son pharise hope resurrect dead i am call question 23 7 when he had so said there aros dissens pharise sadduce multitud wa divid 23 8 sadduce say that there is no resurrect neither angel nor spirit but pharise confess both 23 9 there aros great cri scribe that were pharise part aros strove say we find no evil thi man but if spirit or angel hath spoken him let us not fight against god 23 10 when there aros great dissens chief captain fear lest paul should have been pull piec them command soldier go down take him forc them bring him castl 23 11 night follow lord stood him said be good cheer paul as thou hast testifi me jerusalem so must thou bear wit also rome 23 12 when it wa day certain jew band togeth bound themselv curs say that they would neither eat nor drink till they had kill paul 23 13 they were more than forti which had made thi conspiraci 23 14 they came chief priest elder said we have bound ourselv great curs that we will eat noth we have slain paul 23 15 now therefor ye council signifi chief captain that he bring him down unto you morrow as though ye would enquir someth more perfectli concern him we or ever he come near are readi kill him 23 16 when paul s sister s son heard their lie wait he went enter castl told paul 23 17 then paul call one centurion unto him said bring thi young man unto chief captain he hath certain thing tell him 23 18 so he took him brought him chief captain said paul prison call me unto him pray me bring thi young man unto thee who hath someth say unto thee 23 19 then chief captain took him hand went him asid privat ask him what is that thou hast tell me 23 20 he said jew have agre desir thee that thou wouldest bring down paul morrow council as though they would enquir somewhat him more perfectli 23 21 but do not thou yield unto them there lie wait him them more than forti men which have bound themselv oath that they will neither eat nor drink till they have kill him now are they readi look promis thee 23 22 so chief captain then let young man depart charg him see thou tell no man that thou hast shew these thing me 23 23 he call unto him two centurion say make readi two hundr soldier go caesarea horsemen threescor ten spearmen two hundr third hour night 23 24 provid them beast that they may set paul bring him safe unto felix governor 23 25 he wrote letter thi manner 23 26 claudiu lysia unto most excel governor felix sendeth greet 23 27 thi man wa taken jew should have been kill them then came i armi rescu him have understood that he wa roman 23 28 when i would have known caus wherefor they accus him i brought him forth their council 23 29 whom i perceiv be accus question their law but have noth laid hi charg worthi death or bond 23 30 when it wa told me how that jew laid wait man i sent straightway thee gave command hi accus also say thee what they had against him farewel 23 31 then soldier as it wa command them took paul brought him night antipatri 23 32 morrow they left horsemen go him return castl 23 33 who when they came caesarea deliv epistl governor present paul also him 23 34 when governor had read letter he ask what provinc he wa when he understood that he wa cilicia 23 35 i will hear thee said he when thine accus are also come he command him be kept herod s judgment hall 24 1 five day anania high priest descend elder certain orat name tertullu who inform governor against paul 24 2 when he wa call forth tertullu began accus him say see that thee we enjoy great quiet that veri worthi deed are done unto thi nation thi provid 24 3 we accept it alway all place most nobl felix all thank 24 4 notwithstand that i be not further tediou unto thee i pray thee that thou wouldest hear us thi clemenc few word 24 5 we have found thi man pestil fellow mover sedit all jew world ringlead sect nazaren 24 6 who also hath gone profan templ whom we took would have judg accord our law 24 7 but chief captain lysia came us great violenc took him away our hand 24 8 command hi accus come unto thee examin whom thyself mayest take knowledg all these thing whereof we accus him 24 9 jew also assent say that these thing were so 24 10 then paul that governor had beckon unto him speak answer forasmuch as i know that thou hast been mani year judg unto thi nation i do more cheer answer myself 24 11 becaus that thou mayest understand that there are yet but twelv day i went jerusalem worship 24 12 they neither found me templ disput ani man neither rais peopl neither synagogu nor citi 24 13 neither can they prove thing whereof they now accus me 24 14 but thi i confess unto thee that way which they call heresi so worship i god my father believ all thing which are written law prophet 24 15 have hope god which they themselv also allow that there shall be resurrect dead both just unjust 24 16 herein do i exercis myself have alway conscienc void offenc god men 24 17 now mani year i came bring alm my nation offer 24 18 whereupon certain jew asia found me purifi templ neither multitud nor tumult 24 19 who ought have been here thee object if they had ought against me 24 20 or els let these same here say if they have found ani evil do me while i stood council 24 21 it be thi one voic that i cri stand them touch resurrect dead i am call question you thi day 24 22 when felix heard these thing have more perfect knowledg that way he defer them said when lysia chief captain shall come down i will know uttermost your matter 24 23 he command centurion keep paul let him have liberti that he should forbid none hi acquaint minist or come unto him 24 24 certain day when felix came hi wife drusilla which wa jewess he sent paul heard him concern faith christ 24 25 as he reason righteous temper judgment come felix trembl answer go thi way thi time when i have conveni season i will call thee 24 26 he hope also that money should have been given him paul that he might loos him wherefor he sent him often commun him 24 27 but two year porciu festu came felix room felix will shew jew pleasur left paul bound 25 1 now when festu wa come provinc three day he ascend caesarea jerusalem 25 2 then high priest chief jew inform him against paul besought him 25 3 desir favour against him that he would send him jerusalem lay wait way kill him 25 4 but festu answer that paul should be kept caesarea that he himself would depart shortli thither 25 5 let them therefor said he which you are abl go down me accus thi man if there be ani wicked him 25 6 when he had tarri them more than ten day he went down unto caesarea next day sit judgment seat command paul be brought 25 7 when he wa come jew which came down jerusalem stood round laid mani grievou complaint against paul which they could not prove 25 8 while he answer himself neither against law jew neither against templ nor yet against caesar have i offend ani thing all 25 9 but festu will do jew pleasur answer paul said wilt thou go jerusalem there be judg these thing me 25 10 then said paul i stand caesar s judgment seat where i ought be judg jew have i done no wrong as thou veri well knowest 25 11 if i be offend or have commit ani thing worthi death i refus not die but if there be none these thing whereof these accus me no man may deliv me unto them i appeal unto caesar 25 12 then festu when he had confer council answer hast thou appeal unto caesar unto caesar shalt thou go 25 13 certain day king agrippa bernic came unto caesarea salut festu 25 14 when they had been there mani day festu declar paul s caus unto king say there is certain man left bond felix 25 15 whom when i wa jerusalem chief priest elder jew inform me desir have judgment against him 25 16 whom i answer it is not manner roman deliv ani man die that he which is accus have accus face face have licenc answer himself concern crime laid against him 25 17 therefor when they were come hither ani delay morrow i sat judgment seat command man be brought forth 25 18 against whom when accus stood they brought none accus such thing as i suppos 25 19 but had certain question against him their own superstit one jesu which wa dead whom paul affirm be aliv 25 20 becaus i doubt such manner question i ask him he would go jerusalem there be judg these matter 25 21 but when paul had appeal be reserv unto hear augustu i command him be kept till i might send him caesar 25 22 then agrippa said unto festu i would also hear man myself morrow said he thou shalt hear him 25 23 morrow when agrippa wa come bernic great pomp wa enter place hear chief captain princip men citi festu command paul wa brought forth 25 24 festu said king agrippa all men which are here present us ye see thi man whom all multitud jew have dealt me both jerusalem also here cri that he ought not live ani longer 25 25 but when i found that he had commit noth worthi death that he himself hath appeal augustu i have determin send him 25 26 whom i have no certain thing write unto my lord wherefor i have brought him forth you special thee o king agrippa that examin had i might have somewhat write 25 27 it seemeth me unreason send prison not withal signifi crime laid against him 26 1 then agrippa said unto paul thou art permit speak thyself then paul stretch forth hand answer himself 26 2 i think myself happi king agrippa becaus i shall answer myself thi day thee touch all thing whereof i am accus jew 26 3 especi becaus i know thee be expert all custom question which are jew wherefor i beseech thee hear me patient 26 4 my manner life my youth which wa first mine own nation jerusalem know all jew 26 5 which knew me begin if they would testifi that most straitest sect our religion i live pharise 26 6 now i stand am judg hope promis made god unto our father 26 7 unto which promis our twelv tribe instantli serv god day night hope come which hope s sake king agrippa i am accus jew 26 8 whi should it be thought thing incred you that god should rais dead 26 9 i verili thought myself that i ought do mani thing contrari name jesu nazareth 26 10 which thing i also did jerusalem mani saint did i shut prison have receiv author chief priest when they were put death i gave my voic against them 26 11 i punish them oft everi synagogu compel them blasphem be exceedingli mad against them i persecut them even unto strang citi 26 12 whereupon as i went damascu author commiss chief priest 26 13 midday o king i saw way light heaven bright sun shine round me them which journey me 26 14 when we were all fallen earth i heard voic speak unto me say hebrew tongu saul saul whi persecutest thou me it is hard thee kick against prick 26 15 i said who art thou lord he said i am jesu whom thou persecutest 26 16 but rise stand thi feet i have appear unto thee thi purpos make thee minist wit both these thing which thou hast seen those thing which i will appear unto thee 26 17 deliv thee peopl gentil unto whom now i send thee 26 18 open their eye turn them dark light power satan unto god that they may receiv forgiv sin inherit them which are sanctifi faith that is me 26 19 whereupon o king agrippa i wa not disobedi unto heavenli vision 26 20 but shew first unto them damascu jerusalem all coast judaea then gentil that they should repent turn god do work meet repent 26 21 these caus jew caught me templ went kill me 26 22 have therefor obtain help god i continu unto thi day wit both small great say none other thing than those which prophet mose did say should come 26 23 that christ should suffer that he should be first that should rise dead should shew light unto peopl gentil 26 24 as he thu spake himself festu said loud voic paul thou art besid thyself much learn doth make thee mad 26 25 but he said i am not mad most nobl festu but speak forth word truth sober 26 26 king knoweth these thing whom also i speak freeli i am persuad that none these thing are hidden him thi thing wa not done corner 26 27 king agrippa believest thou prophet i know that thou believest 26 28 then agrippa said unto paul almost thou persuadest me be christian 26 29 paul said i would god that not onli thou but also all that hear me thi day were both almost altogeth such as i am these bond 26 30 when he had thu spoken king rose governor bernic they that sat them 26 31 when they were gone asid they talk themselv say thi man doeth noth worthi death or bond 26 32 then said agrippa unto festu thi man might have been set liberti if he had not appeal unto caesar 27 1 when it wa determin that we should sail itali they deliv paul certain other prison unto one name juliu centurion augustu band 27 2 enter ship adramyttium we launch mean sail coast asia one aristarchu macedonian thessalonica be us 27 3 next day we touch sidon juliu courteous entreat paul gave him liberti go unto hi friend refresh himself 27 4 when we had launch thenc we sail cypru becaus wind were contrari 27 5 when we had sail sea cilicia pamphylia we came myra citi lycia 27 6 there centurion found ship alexandria sail itali he put us therein 27 7 when we had sail slowli mani day scarc were come against cnidu wind not suffer us we sail crete against salmon 27 8 hardli pass it came unto place which is call fair haven nigh whereunto wa citi lasea 27 9 now when much time wa spent when sail wa now danger becaus fast wa now alreadi past paul admonish them 27 10 said unto them sir i perceiv that thi voyag will be hurt much damag not onli lade ship but also our live 27 11 nevertheless centurion believ master owner ship more than those thing which were spoken paul 27 12 becaus haven wa not commodi winter more part advis depart thenc also if ani mean they might attain phenic there winter which is haven crete lieth south west north west 27 13 when south wind blew softli suppos that they had obtain their purpos loos thenc they sail close crete 27 14 but not long there aros against it tempestu wind call euroclydon 27 15 when ship wa caught could not bear wind we let her drive 27 16 run certain island which is call clauda we had much work come boat 27 17 which when they had taken they use help undergird ship fear lest they should fall quicksand strake sail so were driven 27 18 we be exceedingli toss tempest next day they lighten ship 27 19 third day we cast our own hand tackl ship 27 20 when neither sun nor star mani day appear no small tempest lay us all hope that we should be save wa then taken away 27 21 but long abstin paul stood forth midst them said sir ye should have hearken unto me not have loos crete have gain thi harm loss 27 22 now i exhort you be good cheer there shall be no loss ani man s life you but ship 27 23 there stood me thi night angel god whose i am whom i serv 27 24 say fear not paul thou must be brought caesar lo god hath given thee all them that sail thee 27 25 wherefor sir be good cheer i believ god that it shall be even as it wa told me 27 26 howbeit we must be cast certain island 27 27 but when fourteenth night wa come as we were driven down adria midnight shipmen deem that they drew near some countri 27 28 sound found it twenti fathom when they had gone littl further they sound again found it fifteen fathom 27 29 then fear lest we should have fallen rock they cast four anchor stern wish day 27 30 as shipmen were flee ship when they had let down boat sea colour as though they would have cast anchor foreship 27 31 paul said centurion soldier these abid ship ye cannot be save 27 32 then soldier cut off rope boat let her fall off 27 33 while day wa come paul besought them all take meat say thi day is fourteenth day that ye have tarri continu fast have taken noth 27 34 wherefor i pray you take some meat thi is your health there shall not hair fall head ani you 27 35 when he had thu spoken he took bread gave thank god presenc them all when he had broken it he began eat 27 36 then were they all good cheer they also took some meat 27 37 we were all ship two hundr threescor sixteen soul 27 38 when they had eaten enough they lighten ship cast wheat sea 27 39 when it wa day they knew not land but they discov certain creek shore which they were mind if it were possibl thrust ship 27 40 when they had taken anchor they commit themselv unto sea loos rudder band hois mainsail wind made shore 27 41 fall place where two sea met they ran ship aground forepart stuck fast remain unmov but hinder part wa broken violenc wave 27 42 soldier counsel wa kill prison lest ani them should swim escap 27 43 but centurion will save paul kept them their purpos command that they which could swim should cast themselv first sea get land 27 44 rest some board some broken piec ship so it came pass that they escap all safe land 28 1 when they were escap then they knew that island wa call melita 28 2 barbar peopl shew us no littl kind they kindl fire receiv us everi one becaus present rain becaus cold 28 3 when paul had gather bundl stick laid them fire there came viper heat fasten hi hand 28 4 when barbarian saw venom beast hang hi hand they said themselv no doubt thi man is murder whom though he hath escap sea yet vengeanc suffereth not live 28 5 he shook off beast fire felt no harm 28 6 howbeit they look when he should have swollen or fallen down dead suddenli but they had look great while saw no harm come him they chang their mind said that he wa god 28 7 same quarter were possess chief man island whose name wa publiu who receiv us lodg us three day courteous 28 8 it came pass that father publiu lay sick fever bloodi flux whom paul enter pray laid hi hand him heal him 28 9 so when thi wa done other also which had diseas island came were heal 28 10 who also honour us mani honour when we depart they lade us such thing as were necessari 28 11 three month we depart ship alexandria which had winter isl whose sign wa castor pollux 28 12 land syracus we tarri there three day 28 13 thenc we fetch compass came rhegium one day south wind blew we came next day puteoli 28 14 where we found brethren were desir tarri them seven day so we went rome 28 15 thenc when brethren heard us they came meet us as far as appii forum three tavern whom when paul saw he thank god took courag 28 16 when we came rome centurion deliv prison captain guard but paul wa suffer dwell himself soldier that kept him 28 17 it came pass that three day paul call chief jew togeth when they were come togeth he said unto them men brethren though i have commit noth against peopl or custom our father yet wa i deliv prison jerusalem hand roman 28 18 who when they had examin me would have let me go becaus there wa no caus death me 28 19 but when jew spake against it i wa constrain appeal unto caesar not that i had ought accus my nation 28 20 thi caus therefor have i call you see you speak you becaus that hope israel i am bound thi chain 28 21 they said unto him we neither receiv letter judaea concern thee neither ani brethren that came shew or spake ani harm thee 28 22 but we desir hear thee what thou thinkest as concern thi sect we know that everi where it is spoken against 28 23 when they had appoint him day there came mani him hi lodg whom he expound testifi kingdom god persuad them concern jesu both law mose prophet morn till even 28 24 some believ thing which were spoken some believ not 28 25 when they agre not themselv they depart that paul had spoken one word well spake holi ghost esaia prophet unto our father 28 26 say go unto thi peopl say hear ye shall hear shall not understand see ye shall see not perceiv 28 27 heart thi peopl is wax gross their ear are dull hear their eye have they close lest they should see their eye hear their ear understand their heart should be convert i should heal them 28 28 be it known therefor unto you that salvat god is sent unto gentil that they will hear it 28 29 when he had said these word jew depart had great reason themselv 28 30 paul dwelt two whole year hi own hire hous receiv all that came unto him 28 31 preach kingdom god teach those thing which concern lord jesu christ all confid no man forbid him you but wa let hitherto that i might have some fruit you also even as other gentil 1 14 i am debtor both greek barbarian both wise unwis 1 15 so as much as me is i am readi preach gospel you that are rome also 1 16 i am not asham gospel christ it is power god unto salvat everi one that believeth jew first also greek 1 17 therein is righteous god reveal faith faith as it is written just shall live faith 1 18 wrath god is reveal heaven against all ungodli unright men who hold truth unright 1 19 becaus that which may be known god is manifest them god hath shew it unto them 1 20 invis thing him creation world are clearli seen be understood thing that are made even hi etern power godhead so that they are excus 1 21 becaus that when they knew god they glorifi him not as god neither were thank implac unmerci 1 32 who know judgment god that they which commit such thing are worthi death not onli do same but have pleasur them that do them 2 1 therefor thou art inexcus o man whosoev thou art that judgest wherein thou judgest anoth thou condemnest thyself thou that judgest doest same thing 2 2 but we are sure that judgment god is accord truth against them which commit such thing 2 3 thinkest thou thi o man that judgest them which do such thing doest same that thou shalt escap judgment god 2 4 or despisest thou rich hi good forbear longsuff not know that good god leadeth thee repent 2 5 but thi hard impenit heart treasurest unto thyself wrath against day wrath revel righteou judgment god 2 6 who will render everi man accord hi deed 2 7 them who patient continu well do seek their heart their conscienc also bear wit their thought mean while accus or els excus one anoth 2 16 day when god shall judg secret men jesu christ accord my gospel 2 17 behold thou art call jew restest law makest thi boast god 2 18 knowest hi will approvest thing that are more excel be instruct law 2 19 art confid that thou thyself art guid blind light them which are dark 2 20 instructor foolish teacher babe which hast form knowledg truth law 2 21 thou therefor which teachest anoth teachest thou not thyself thou that preachest man should not steal dost thou steal 2 22 thou that sayest man should not commit adulteri dost thou commit adulteri thou that abhorrest idol dost thou commit sacrileg 2 23 thou that makest thi boast law break law dishonourest thou god 2 24 name god is blasphem gentil you as it is written 2 25 circumcis verili profiteth if thou keep law but if thou be breaker law thi circumcis is made uncircumcis 2 26 therefor if uncircumcis keep righteous law shall not hi uncircumcis be count circumcis 2 27 shall not uncircumcis which is natur if it fulfil law judg thee who letter circumcis dost transgress law 2 28 he is not jew which is one outwardli neither is that circumcis which is outward flesh 2 29 but he is jew which is one inwardli circumcis is that heart spirit not letter whose prais is not men but god 3 1 what advantag then hath jew or what profit is there circumcis 3 2 much everi way chiefli becaus that unto them were commit oracl god 3 3 what if some did not believ shall their unbelief make faith god effect 3 4 god forbid yea let god be true briefli comprehend thi say name thou shalt love thi neighbour as thyself 13 10 love worketh no ill hi neighbour therefor love is fulfil law 13 11 that know time that now it is high time awak sleep now is our salvat nearer than when we believ 13 12 night is far spent day is hand let us therefor cast off work dark let us put armour light 13 13 let us walk honestli as day not riot drunken not chamber wanton not strife envi 13 14 but put ye lord jesu christ make not provis flesh fulfil lust thereof 14 1 him that is weak faith receiv ye but not doubt disput 14 2 one believeth that he may eat all thing anoth who is weak eateth herb 14 3 let not him that eateth despis him that eateth not let not him which eateth not judg him that eateth god hath receiv him 14 4 who art thou that judgest anoth hi own mind 14 6 he that regardeth day regardeth it unto lord he that regardeth not day lord he doth not regard it he that eateth eateth lord he giveth god thank he that eateth not lord he eateth not that he might be lord both dead live 14 10 but whi dost thou judg thi brother or whi dost thou set nought thi brother we shall all stand judgment seat christ 14 11 it is written as i live saith lord buildeth thereupon 3 11 other foundat can no man lay than that is laid which is jesu christ 3 12 now if ani man build thi foundat gold silver preciou stone wood hay stubbl 3 13 everi man s work shall
